fields.narrative:
Quick moving system provides wintry mix to the area

Between 4 - 7 AM on November 24th, a light wintry mix of, snow, sleet, and rain started to occur. This light wintry mix was brief and any accumulating precipitation ended by 9 AM with temperatures between 30 - 32 degrees. A second batch of rain, snow, and sleet arrived between 12 - 3 PM, with any wintry precipitation ending by midnight. Temperatures at this time were between 34 - 38 degrees.

Lake effect snow showers and flurries on December 9th

Light lake effect snow showers and flurries started to occur during the morning hours on December 9th. While most locations saw snow end by noon, a few pockets of flurries continued into the afternoon and evening. Temperatures throughout the event were between 15 - 27 degrees. Any additional snowfall that occurred on December 11th will be handled in a separate report.

Wintry mix occurred December 26th

With temperatures between 28 - 32 degrees, a brief period of freezing rain and sleet occurred between 1 - 3 PM on December 28th. As temperatures warmed into the low-mid 30s by the late afternoon, the precipitation made a transition to plain rain.

Freezing drizzle occurred January 3rd

Freezing drizzle started to occur between 4 - 7 AM on the 3rd with temperatures between 30 - 32 degrees. The freezing drizzle continued through the morning, but as temperatures warmed above 32 degrees by 11 AM, the freezing drizzle transitioned to plain rain.

Low pressure system brought snow January 10th-11th

Between 3 - 6 PM on the 10th, light snow and flurries started to occur in the area with temperatures between 32 - 34 degrees. As temperatures rose into the mid/upper 30s by midnight, the light snow started to mix with rain before ending between 2 - 5 AM on the 11th. Winds occasionally gusted between 35 - 45 mph throughout the event.

Scattered snow showers and flurries January 27th

Between 2 - 5 AM on the 27th, scattered snow showers and flurries started to occur in the area. The snow showers and flurries continued throughout the morning before ending between 9 - 11 AM. Temperatures throughout the event were between 34 - 37 degrees and winds occasionally gusted between 30 - 40 mph.

Scattered snow showers and flurries occurred February 4th

Between 12-3 AM, light and scattered snow showers/flurries started to occur in the area. They continued throughout the morning and into the early afternoon, where between 1-4 PM they came to an end. Temperatures started the event between 17-20 degrees, but gradually warmed to between 28-31 degrees by the end.

Clipper system brought snow showers across the state

Between 5-8 PM on February 5th, light snow and flurries started to occur in the area. The light snow and flurries were brief, and by midnight they came to an end. Temperatures throughout the event were between 33-36 degrees. Winds also occasionally gusted between 30-40 mph.

Scattered snow showers occurred February 15th-17th

During the early morning of the 15th, scattered snow showers and flurries started to occur in the area. By the afternoon, the precipitation tapered to flurries. Occasional and scattered flurries and snow showers then lingered throughout the 16th and into the morning of the 17th, where they came to an end by 7 AM. Temperatures started the event between 33-36 degrees, but gradually decreased into the low-20s by the end.

Scattered snow showers/flurries March 10th-11th

A brief but moderate to heavy snow shower occurred between 9 PM and midnight on the 10th. Pockets of flurries and brief snow showers then lingered into the 11th, where they came to an end by 8 PM. Temperatures were in the teens throughout the event, while winds occasionally gusted between 30-40 mph.

Rain to snow March 25th

During the morning of the 25th, light rain showers were occurring in the area. As they increased in intensity, they briefly mixed with snow and sleet between 11 AM - 3 PM. By 3 PM, the precipitation transitioned back to plain rain. Temperatures were between 34-37 degrees.

Passing Cold Front Produces Wintry Mix

A cold front began producing intermittent rain in the area the evening of November 9th. Early the next morning, the 10th, snow began mixing in with the rain, changing to all snow by 4AM. From there, the snow continued on and off as lake effect bands of light snow continued to influence the area. A few hours later, the event came to a close 8 - 10AM when the snow showers ended completely. Conditions were quite breezy in association with the front yielding winds of 25-30mph. Temperatures began in the mid 40's and steadily cooled to end the event 27 - 29 degrees.

Late November Passing Rain / Snow Showers

Early on the morning of November 27th, some light snow mixed with rain fell intermittently from 4 - 8AM. Temperatures were 32 - 36 degrees.

Lake Effect Snow Showers Influence the Region

Some light scattered snow showers passed through the region on December 7th mainly, 5 - 10AM. After that some areas saw a few more scattered and light snow showers ending for good that night 6 - 8PM. Temperatures for the event were mild, 34 - 36 degrees.

Mid-December Lake Effect Snow Showers

Scattered snow showers / flurries fell on December 15th beginning 9PM - 12AM and continued into the following day, the 16th, as the light snow tapered off 2 - 4PM. Temperatures for the event began 20 - 22 degrees and warmed to end 25 - 28.

Intermittent Snow Showers Dec. 20

Light and scattered snow showers began to influence the area the morning of December 20th, 4 - 6AM with temperatures 34 - 36 degrees. The snow fell intermittently in spots throughout the day ending for good that night 9 - 11PM with temperatures that had cooled to be 27 - 30.

December 18th Snowfall

Snow fell on and off on December 18th beginning 1 - 3AM and largely ended a few hours later, 11AM - 1PM. Temperatures began 10 - 14 degrees and warmed to finish 28 - 32.

Snowfall to Bring in the New Year

Scattered, light snow showers fell in the area beginning the morning of January 2nd, 2 - 4AM with temperatures -2 to 2 degrees. Snow was intermittent and light falling on and off in spots before mainly ending that afternoon 3 - 5PM with temperatures 8 - 12 degrees.
Light and scattered snow flurries / showers fell the night of the 5th from 5 - 11PM with winds gusting 30mph and temperatures 2 - 6 degrees.

Intermittent Light Snow Jan 9

Light and scattered snow showers / flurries redeveloped early on January 9th, 1 - 4AM with temperatures 25 - 27 degrees. Snow was largely intermittent in nature falling in spots throughout the day before ending everywhere, 4 - 7PM that night. Temperatures finished a bit warmer, 30 - 32 degrees.

Nighttime Snow January 18th

A lake effect band brought some light snow to the area the night of January 18th from 7 - 11PM with temperatures 20 - 23 degrees.

Cold Temps and Drizzle Produce Freezing Rain

Very light, patchy drizzle moved into the area early the morning of January 22nd and as temperatures were near freezing, 32 - 34 degrees, freezing rain occurred from 12 - 5AM resulting in some ice development. Anything falling after that was plain drizzle as temperatures rose into the mid 30s.
A few very light and scattered lake effect snow showers passed over the region the morning of January 24th between 6AM - 12PM with temperatures 26 - 28 degrees.
A period of snow occurred the afternoon of January 31st from 3 - 6PM with temperatures 25 - 27 degrees.

System Brings Light Snow Feb. 6

Snow showers began the morning of February 6th, 7 - 9AM. Around noon, only light, lake effect flurries remained in spots which ended for good 4 - 6PM. Temperatures for the event were 18 - 22 degrees.

Icy Conditions from Freezing Rain

A period of rain transitioned to light freezing rain from 10 PM Feb 10 - 1 AM Feb 11. A lull in the freezing rain occurred between 3 AM and 7 AM Feb 11, with another period of moderate freezing rain falling through 4:30 - 6:30 PM Feb 11. Temperatures held steady near freezing, 30 - 32 degrees for the majority of the event, falling to a low point of around 28 degrees around daybreak the 11th.

Weak Cold Front Produces Light Snow

After some morning rain showers, a weak cold front pushed through the area overnight February 16th, bringing light lake effect snow showers to the region which fell from 9 - 11PM. A few hours later, a brief returning flurry fell the morning of the 17th, 5 - 7AM. Temperatures began 32 - 34 degrees and cooled to finish in the upper 20s.

Quick Shot of Freezing Rain

Light rain showers began the morning of February 23rd and as temperatures were 30 - 32 degrees, pockets of freezing rain occurred from 9AM - 1PM. However, due to preceding warmth, much of the icing was confined to colder, elevated surfaces. After that, as steadier precipitation arrived, temperatures warmed safely above freezing and precipitation became plain rain.

Morning Wintry Mix February 25th

Sleet began early the morning of February 25th, 3 - 5AM with temperatures 30 - 32 degrees. However, as day broke and temperatures began to rise, sleet mixed with light freezing rain which worked to transition to plain rain a few hours later between 10AM - 12PM as temperatures rose into the mid 30s.

Persistent Light Snow Showers March 4-5

Light and scattered snow showers moved into the region the morning of March 4th between 8 - 10AM with temperatures marginal, 34 - 36 degrees. Steadiest snow fell that afternoon between 12 - 5PM as temperatures dropped a few degrees to be near 32. After that, snow became scattered once again mainly ending 7 - 9PM despite some scattered, overnight flurries that completely exited by 5 - 7AM on the 5th with temperatures holding 30 - 32 degrees.

Upper Level Disturbance Produces Snow Showers

After a brief lull, flurries worked back into the area the morning of March 9th, 2 - 4AM with temperatures 27 - 30 degrees. Late morning, steadier snow worked into the region from 10AM - 12PM as temperatures rose into the mid 30s, 34 - 36, and winds gusted to 25mph at times. By 3 - 5PM, snow largely tapered off. That night, only a few scattered snow showers fell as a potent lake effect band set up to the west, mainly 3 - 5AM the morning of the 10th, and again around 8AM. Temperatures rose from an overnight low of 28 - 30 to finish 32 - 34 degrees.

Mid-March Snow Showers

A few scattered snow showers fell the night of March 16th between 7PM - 1AM (the 17th) with temperatures 25 - 30 degrees. After that, only a light flurry or two persisted into the morning ending by midday. Winds were a bit gusty, becoming 25 mph at times.

Early April Winter Weather

Rain mixed with some sleet and snow the morning of April 3rd between 10AM - 1PM becoming plain rain after. Temperatures for the event were 34 - 38 degrees.

Cold Front Triggers Scattered April Snow Showers 

Light and scattered snow showers fell overnight on April 4th mainly between 8PM - 2AM the following morning, the 5th. After that only a light snow shower or two fell ending for good in the predawn hours of the 5th. Temperatures began in the mid 30s and cooled as a cold front came through, ending 25 - 30 degrees. Associated with the cold front, winds were gusting 25 - 35 mph.

Snow Showers April 8th

Widespread snow showers began midday on April 8th, 11AM - 1PM and fell throughout the afternoon. That evening, snow became intermittent and tapered off 8 - 10PM. Temperatures for the event were marginal, 32 - 36 degrees.

Late-Season Sleet and Freezing Rain Event

Scattered areas of sleet and freezing rain began the night of April 14th, 9 - 11PM becoming widespread after midnight, the 15th. Continuing throughout the early morning, precipitation fell as mainly freezing rain from 7 - 11AM, taking a break into the afternoon. Temperatures began 28 - 30 and rose by midday to be 34 - 36. It wasn't until later that evening that another round of rain worked back into the area and as temperatures fell 30 - 32 degrees, precipitation became freezing rain 6 - 8PM. Periods of freezing rain continued overnight and into the morning of the 16th, ending 3 - 5AM as temperatures again rose 34 - 36 prompting any precipitation after to fall as plain rain.
A mix of rain, snow and sleet fell on April 19th between 4 - 7AM with temperatures 34 - 38 degrees.

Quick moving system delivered snow December 13th - 14th

With temperatures between 32 - 36 degrees, flurries and light snow began to develop between 6 - 9 PM on the 13th. The light snow was brief, and by 1 AM any accumulating snow came to an end with flurries ending in the the morning. Temperatures by the end of the event decreased to 30 - 32 degrees.

A period of rain/snow occurred December 31st-January 1st

Light snow and flurries started to occur between 2 - 5 PM on the 31st. The light snow and flurries continued through the evening and into the 1st, where it mixed with rain at times before ending between 12 - 3 AM on the 1st. Temperatures held steady between 33 - 37 degrees throughout the event. Winds occasionally gusted between 25 - 30 mph.

Lake effect snow showers occurred January 8th

Between 12 - 3 AM, lake effect snow showers and flurries started to occur in the area. The light snow showers continued through the morning hours, before tapering to flurries and ending between 8 - 11 AM. Temperatures throughout the event were between 17-20 degrees.

Wintry mix occurred January 17th-18th

Between 12 - 3 PM on the 17th, a light wintry mix of sleet, rain, and freezing rain started to occur with temperatures between 32 - 34 degrees. The light wintry mix continued throughout the 17th and into the morning of the 18th, where it eventually transitioned to plain rain towards sunrise. Temperatures then warmed into the mid-30s as drizzle continued through the morning.

Late March Snow Showers

A few light snow showers passed through the region overnight March 24th - 25th between 9PM - 12AM and again 3 - 7AM. Overall, snow was light with temperatures 28 - 32 degrees.

Lake effect snow December 15th

During the early morning on the 15th, light and scattered lake effect snow showers started to occur in the area with temperatures in the low 20s. The scattered snow showers continued into the afternoon and evening, where it turned steady and moderate at times. By 7 PM, the steady snow tapered to flurries, with any lingering flurries ending by 10 PM. Temperatures by the end of the event decreased into the teens, while winds gusted between 30 - 35 mph at times.

Light snow and flurries December 28th

Light snow and flurries started to occur between 2 - 5 AM on the 28th. The light snow continued through the morning, becoming scattered at times. Flurries continued into the afternoon, with any lingering flurries ending between 3 - 6 PM. Temperatures held steady between 32 - 35 degrees throughout the event.

Lake effect snow showers December 29th-31st

Flurries and light snow showers returned between 10 PM on the 29th and 1 AM on December 30th. These light snow showers and flurries continued intermittently throughout the day and into the morning of the 31st, where a brief and light-moderate snow shower occurred before ending by 11 AM. Temperatures started out the event between 32 - 35 degrees, but decreased into the mid-upper 20s by the end. Winds occasionally gusted between 25 - 35 mph.

Scattered snow showers/flurries occurred January 4th - 6th

During the afternoon of the 4th, scattered snow showers/flurries began to occur with temperatures between 32 - 35 degrees. These snow showers/flurries continued off and on into the morning of the 5th, where a lull in the precipitation then occurred. Snow showers and flurries then returned during the evening of the 5th, which ended during the morning of the 6th. Temperatures throughout the event gradually decreased into the mid-upper 20s. Winds occasionally gusted between 35 - 45 mph.

Light Snowfall January 7 - 8

Scattered snow showers began to influence the area late on January 7th, 9 - 11PM with temperatures 8 - 12 degrees. Snow was mainly light and intermittent falling in spots throughout the morning of the 8th with winds gusting to 25mph. That afternoon, snow largely clearing out from 2 - 4PM as temperatures warmed a bit to finish 22 - 25 degrees.

Late January Low Pressure Snowfall

A winter weather system brought snow to the region that began falling January 30th from 5 - 8AM with temperatures 22 - 25 degrees. Pockets of steady, more moderate snow worked into the area and fell at times throughout the morning with winds gusting to 25mph at times. Snow became overall light that afternoon largely ending 9 - 11PM with only a few lake effect snow showers lasting in spots overnight. The following morning, the 31st, any light snow showers ended for good 4 - 6AM with temperatures that had cooled to finish 15 - 17 degrees.

Snow throughout the Day Feb. 9

A warm front brought snow to the area beginning February 9th, 12 - 2PM. Snow was mainly light and scattered, tapering off to end 9 - 11PM. Temperatures for the event held steady 24 - 28 degrees.

Low pressure system brought wintry mix to the area

Between 7-10 AM on February 7th, a light wintry mix of snow, sleet and freezing rain started to occur in the area with temperatures between 28-32 degrees. As the precipitation continued throughout the morning and into the afternoon, the wintry mix transitioned to freezing rain. Light freezing rain then persisted into the evening, where it turned to plain rain by 7 PM as temperatures warmed into the mid-30s.

Scattered snow showers occurred March 2nd-3rd

With the passage of a potent cold front, snow showers started to occur between 6-9 AM on March 2nd. Light snow showers then continued throughout the morning and into the afternoon, where winds gusted between 40-50 mph resulting in blowing snow. A lull in precipitation occurred before pockets of briefly heavy snow showers returned during the afternoon of the 3rd. These snow showers continued into the late evening before ending between 9 PM and midnight. Temperatures started the event in the 20s, but dipped into the teens by the end.

Wintry mix occurred March 24th

Between 8-11 AM on the 24th, light to moderate snow started to occur in the area. Shortly after, the snow began to mix with sleet and freezing rain. As the precipitation decreased in intensity between 12-3 PM, it transitioned to plain rain and came to an end. Temperatures started out between 29-32 degrees, but warmed to 33-37 in the afternoon.

Lake Effect Snow Showers November 19 - 20

On November 19th, snow began 9 - 11PM as the result of some lake effect snow. The snow was light and fell on and off throughout the night and into the following morning, mainly ending 5 - 7AM. Winds were a bit high due to the front 25 - 30mph with temperatures 30 - 32 degrees.

Arctic Front Brings Wintry Mix

As an arctic front began to influence the region late on January 12th, rain transitioned to freezing rain around midnight as temperatures, which were previously in the 50s, dramatically dropped to be near freezing, 30 - 34 degrees. Sleet began to mix in with the precipitation 1 - 3AM, along with embedded areas of snow. A sleet / snow mix fell that morning becoming moderate and a bit heavy in spots before becoming light and intermittent midday. From there, on and off snow showers persisted into the afternoon coming to a close that evening, 3 - 5PM. Winds were gusting to 30mph at times throughout the event causing blowing and drifting. When all was said and done, temperatures ended 16 - 20 degrees.

Mid-January Light Snow Showers

Scattered snow showers worked their way into the region the night of January 15th beginning 11PM - 1AM (the 16th). Snow was mainly light and intermittent tapering off that morning from 5 - 7AM. Temperatures were 11 - 15 degrees for the event.

Cold Front Produces Early February Snow

After a few scattered, light snow flurries during the day of February 1st, a cold front came through bringing steady, light pockets of snow to the region which fell from 9PM - 3AM on the 2nd. Temperatures began in the mid 30s and quickly cooled to finish 26 - 28 degrees along with winds gusting 25mph at times throughout the event.

Low pressure system brings snow across the area

Between 1 - 4 AM on December 22nd, scattered light snow and flurries started to occur. By 6 AM, they developed into a steadier snow. The steady and light snow was brief, and between 8 - 11 AM it tapered to flurries and came to an end. Temperatures throughout the event held steady between 28 - 32 degrees.

Snow to Freezing Rain Event.

Snow began between 1 - 3AM on the 22nd with temperatures around 20 degrees. Snow was light, and became intermittent through the morning and afternoon hours, with the steadier snow just to the north. Late in the day, some sleet began to mix in, with freezing rain showers following overnight. This resulted resulted in icy conditions with temperatures still in the 20s. Steadier freezing rain arrived early on the 23rd, and transitioned to mainly plain rain by Noon as temperatures most locations rose to 33 - 36 degrees. Rain ended in the evening.

Another Round of April Snow

A period of steady snow fell on April 6th between 8AM - 2PM as temperatures increased from 32 - 34 degrees into the upper 30s. After that, scattered rain showers fell at times throughout the afternoon, transitioning back to a period of snow as a cold front sunk through the area early on the 7th between 1 - 7AM with temperatures 28 - 32 degrees. Winds were a bit gusty during the event, briefly becoming 25mph at times.

Fast moving system occurred December 6th - 7th

Between 10 PM on the 6th and 1 AM on the 7th, light snow started to occur in the area. The light snow continued into the morning of the 7th which turned to flurries and sprinkles by 5 AM. Flurries and sprinkles continued through the morning before ending between 8 - 11 AM. Temperatures for the event were between 32 - 34 degrees.

Lengthy On & Off Lake Effect Snow Showers

Snow showers / flurries began to push their way back into the region the morning of the 10th, 7 - 9AM. The snow was light and intermittent falling in some spots throughout the afternoon and into the following morning, the 11th. It wasn't until late that morning that snow was a bit more consistent, from 11AM - 2PM. After a brief lull, the snow again picked up early on the 12th, 1 - 3AM. From there, snow persisted through 7AM, with anything falling after this timeframe covered in the following report. Temperatures during the day were 32 - 34 degrees, cooling to be 27 - 30 during the overnight periods.

A disturbance produced another round of additional snow across New York on December 30th.

Snow developed between 6 and 9 AM.  A steady period of light snow was observed for most of this event.  Temperatures ranged from 5 to 15 degrees.  The snow tapered off to scattered flurries after sunset and diminished completely between 6 and 9 PM.

Long duration event brings snow to the state

On November 20th, a rain/snow/sleet mix between 2 - 5 AM started to develop with temperatures between 33 - 38 degrees. Shortly after, the precipitation became all snow where it mixed with rain at times in the afternoon. Light snow and flurries then persisted through the 21st, becoming scattered at times throughout the afternoon, with only a few flurries lingering into the 22nd. Temperatures by the end of the event were between 28 - 32 degrees, while strong northwest winds gusted between 30 - 35 mph.

A period of light snow on December 5th

Light snow started to move into the area between 2 - 5 AM on December 5th. The light and steady snow continued through the morning before tapering to flurries and ending between 9 AM - Noon. Temperatures were between 28 - 34 degrees.

Continued Lake Effect Snow Showers Influence the Region 

Snow continued to fall on December 12th at 7AM becoming steady in areas into the early afternoon. From there, the snow transitioned to be mainly rain beginning 12 - 2PM with temperatures that were 32 - 34 degrees. That evening, it began to snow once again 5 - 7PM falling lightly and intermittently into the night and following morning, the 13th. Snow continued on and off in spots throughout the 13th as temperatures fell to be 16 - 19 degrees. It wasn't until the following morning, the 14th, that the scattered snow showers finally came to a close 8 - 10AM.

Quick & Potent Disturbance Produces Snow April 2

Areas of light and steady snow worked through the region between 5 - 10AM as a potent winter weather system passed to the south. Temperatures for the event were 28 - 32 degrees during the event before warming into the mid to upper 40s that afternoon.

A late October storm brought a wintry mix across the area

Between 9 AM and noon on October 27th, light snow started to occur.  The light snow continued through the afternoon, mixing with sleet at times.  The light snow and sleet transitioned to plain rain between 3 - 6 PM with rain continuing through the night.  Temperatures for the event were between 33 - 36 degrees.

A period of steady snow occurred February 10th-11th

Between 7-10 PM on the 10th, a period of steady and light to moderate snow began to occur in the area. The steady snow continued into the morning of the 11th, where it tapered to flurries and came to an end between 3-6 AM. Temperatures started the event between 18-22 degrees, but gradually increased to 26-29 degrees by the end.

Wintry mix occurred March 31st-April 1st

Between 11 PM on March 30th and 2 AM on the 31st, a light to moderate and steady snow began to occur. Steady snow continued throughout the morning, before mixing with rain and sleet by 8 AM. Periods of rain, sleet and snow persisted throughout the 31st and into the morning of April 1st, where pockets of freezing rain also occurred with some spots at 32 degrees. Between 9 AM and noon, the mix came to an end. Temperatures were between 32-37 degrees throughout the event.

Fast-Moving System Produces Overnight Snow 

On the night of February 17th, as a low pressure system tracked up the east coast, light snow began 6 – 8PM, quickly becoming steady. Snow continued into the early morning of the 18th and while mainly light in intensity, persisted with embedded pockets of steadier snow that fell for a few hours before quickly tapered off 4 – 6AM. After that, only a light flurry or two fell in spots before ending for good 8 – 10AM. Temperatures for the event began near freezing, 30 – 32 degrees, and fell a bit to finish 26 – 28.

Steady snow December 11th - 12th

Pockets of AM flurries gave way to a steady snow between 3 - 6 PM 11th. The steady snow continued into the morning of the 12th, where it turned moderate at times. Between 8 - 11 AM, the steady snow tapered to flurries and eventually came to an end. Temperatures throughout the event were between 26 - 32 degrees.

Clipper system brings snow to the state

Between 9 AM and noon on January 31st, a light to moderate snow began to occur in the area. The snow continued steadily throughout the 31st and into the 1st of February. The snow tapered to flurries during the late morning, and by 2 PM any accumulating snow came to an end. Temperatures started the event between 23-25 degrees but gradually rose to the mid-30s by the end.

Low pressure system brought snow across the state

Between 7 - 10 AM on December 29th, a steady and light snow started to occur in the area. The light snow continued through the morning hours, becoming moderate at times. As the system departed the area in the early afternoon, the snow mixed with rain and sleet in some spots before ending between 2 - 5 PM. Temperatures were in the low-mid 30s throughout the event. Any additional snow that occurred on the 29th will be handled in a separate report.

Superbowl Wintry Mix Event

On February 4th, snow worked into the region beginning 7 - 9AM with temperatures 32 - 34 degrees and winds gusting 25 - 30 mph causing blowing and drifting. Snow fell throughout the afternoon becoming more moderate around 4 - 7PM. From there, precipitation became a mix of rain, snow, sleet, and freezing rain, as temperatures held steady near or just above freezing. The mix tapered off just after midnight, the 5th, as a few lake effect snow showers set up. From there, a few snow showers passed through the region exiting 8 - 11AM with temperatures that had fallen to be 27 - 30 degrees.

Coastal storm brought wintry mix across the area

Between 6 - 9 PM on January 23rd, a light wintry mix of snow, sleet, rain, and freezing rain started to occur with temperatures between 32 - 34 degrees. The wintry mix continued into the afternoon, where it transitioned to snow, sleet, and rain as temperatures rose above 32 degrees. By the evening, a light-moderate snow began to develop, and in the morning of the 25th it came to an end. Temperatures by the end of the event were between 28 - 32 degrees. Winds occasionally gusted between 25 - 35 mph.

Low pressure system brings wintry mix to the area

Between 12 - 3 AM on December 17th, light snow began to occur in the area with temperatures in the low 20s. The snow continued through the morning where it became moderate to heavy at times. By the afternoon the snow tapered to flurries, with steady precipitation returning as freezing rain in some spots during the evening. With temperatures gradually warming into the 30s, the freezing rain continued in some spots into the morning of the 18th before transitioning to plain rain.

December 9th Clipper System 

On the afternoon of December 9th, a clipper system passing to the southeast brought snow to the region which began falling 12 - 2PM. The snow was mainly light with a few embedded steady periods which occurred in the evening. The event came to a close as the system moved out 9 - 11PM. Temperatures began near 32 degrees and fell to end the event 24 - 27.

A winter storm brings snow to the region on February 22

A winter storm impacted the area on February 22nd. Snow began to develop across the area between 9am-12pm and quickly became steady. Though it was light at the onset, it wasn’t long before periods of moderate to occasionally heavy snow made their way into the area and fell into the afternoon and evening. The snow tapered back off in intensity to flurries before ending between 3-6PM. Temperatures throughout the event were initially 33-36 degrees, but fell to 29-32 degrees in steadiest/heaviest snow.

Lake effect snow affected New York on December 24th and 25th.

Snow developed between 9 PM and midnight on the 24th.  A steady period of light to occasionally moderate snow occurred.  Temperatures were in the mid to upper 20s.  The snow tapered off between 10 AM and 1 PM on the 25th.

Additional snow occurred on the 26th and will be discussed in the next report.

Coastal Storm Impacts the Region

Steady, light snow began to fall the morning of January 4th, 7 - 10AM, as a potent nor'easter traveled up the east coast. Snow quickly became more moderate after 12PM as winds picked up and blew the snow around with gusts reaching 25mph at times. That evening, the snow became light, tapering off to finish 9 - 11PM. Temperatures were near 15 - 19 degrees for the event.

Low Pressure Brings Persistent Snow

Steady snow redeveloped the morning of January 16th, 9 - 11AM. Snow was largely light but persistent as it fell steadily throughout the 16th and into the 17th with some embedded pockets of more moderate snow falling at times. It wasn't until the afternoon of the 17th that steady snow transitioned to be scattered snow showers beginning 2 - 4PM, and ending a few hours later 6 - 8PM. Temperatures began 27 - 30 degrees and fell throughout the event to finish 16 - 20.

Winter Storm Followed by Lake Effect

A large scale weather system brought snow to the area beginning the morning of February 7th, 8 - 10AM, quickly becoming moderate and heavy in spots with temperatures 17 - 20 degrees. Pockets of moderate to heavy snow continued into the afternoon before returning to be mainly light snow between 1 - 3PM. As snow became light again, it transitioned to be a mix of sleet and freezing rain which fell with temperatures holding near 20 degrees, before tapered off that evening, 6 - 8PM as lake effect snow filled in behind the system. Any snow produced from the lake effect was light and scattered, falling intermittently before ending for good early the morning of the 8th, 1 - 2AM as winds began gusting to 25mph. Temperatures finished 20 - 23 degrees.

Powerful storm brought snow February 12th-13th

Between 6-9 AM on the 12th, a light to moderate snow began to develop in the area. As the snow continued into the afternoon, it became heavy at times. Moderate to heavy snow then persisted through the evening before tapering to scattered snow showers by midnight. Scattered snow showers and flurries then lingered into the 13th, where they came to an end between 6-9 AM. Temperatures throughout the event were between 24-28 degrees, and winds gusted between 30-40 mph which lead to blowing and drifting snow.

Coastal System Produces Lengthy Snowfall

As yet another coastal system began influencing the region the night of March 12th, light snow showers began 7 - 9PM with temperatures 38 - 40 degrees. Snow became steady around midnight with temperatures falling to 32 in the predawn hours, 3 - 5AM. This continued into the afternoon as a few bands of moderate / heavy, lake enhanced snow formed over the region 3 - 5PM. A few hours later, 9 - 11PM, as temperatures fell 28 - 30, snow became light again with embedded pockets of steady snow falling overnight and into the morning of the 14th. Steady snow tapered to light and scattered snow showers midday as temperatures rose 32 - 36 and winds picked up gusting to 25mph at times. Continuing on and off into the night, light and scattered snow showers exits for good early on the 15th, 4 - 6AM, as temperatures remained steady near to above freezing.

Strong low pressure system delivered snow across the area

Between 2-5 AM on February 9th, a heavy snow quickly developed in the area, producing 2-4" an hour snowfall rates and visibilities under 1/2 mile. Moderate to heavy snow continued throughout the morning and into the early afternoon before turning light by 3 PM. Between 4-7 PM, any lingering flurries came to an end. Temperatures started the event between 27-30 degrees, but gradually decreased to 14-17 degrees. Winds gusted between 20-30 mph at times, which resulted in occasional drifting snow.

Another Nor'easter Triggers Persistent Snow Showers

Early on March 7th, a nor'easter brought snow to the region which began 1 - 3AM with marginal temperatures, 32 - 36 degrees. Snow was steady and fell moderately / heavily at times throughout the morning and afternoon, mainly 8 - 9AM, and again 2 - 6PM as temperatures hovered 31 - 33. After that, snow was mainly light but persistent, continuing at times throughout the night and into the 8th, becoming scattered after midnight. From there, snow showers fell intermittently throughout the day with a steadier snow shower occurring 2 - 8PM. Overall, snow tapered off 9 - 11PM as temperatures held near 30.

Early March Nor'easter Dumps Snow

Rain quickly turned to steady snow the night of March 1st between 9 - 11PM with temperatures in the mid-upper 30s. In the coming hours, around 2 - 4AM, as temperatures cooled to be 32 - 34 degrees, moderate and heavy pockets of snow developed, and fell throughout the morning, falling heaviest around 7 - 9AM. By midday, snow became generally light again, tapering off the afternoon of the 2nd, 5 - 7PM with only some light snow and scattered snow showers ending by midnight. Temperatures held steady at 32 - 34 degrees to end the event. In addition, winds were gusty becoming 25 - 30mph at times throughout the storm.

Major storm buries the state with snow

Between 2-5 AM on March 14th, a light to moderate snow started to develop. Towards sunrise, steadier snow developed that produced snowfall rates of 2-3" per hour at times in the afternoon. Periods of steady and heavy snow continued throughout the afternoon before turning light to moderate in the evening. By midnight, the snow tapered to flurries and snow showers, which lingered throughout the 15th before ending by 9 PM. Winds throughout the event were sustained 10-20 mph and occasionally gusted to 30-40 mph, which resulted in blowing and drifting snow at times. Temperatures throughout the event were in the upper teens and low 20s.

Storm Brings Wintry Mix to Region December 17th

A storm system brought a wintry mix of snow, sleet and freezing rain to the area during the morning hours December 17th. With temperatures in the upper 20s to near 32 degrees, precipitation began across the area from 2-5 AM as a mix of snow, sleet and freezing rain. Shortly thereafter, precipitation turned to freezing rain, and continued until ending between 8-11 AM. Areas of drizzle and freezing drizzle lingered into the early afternoon hours, which lead to some icy patches as temperatures were slow to rise above freezing.

Storm Brings Some Snow January 5-6

A fast-moving storm system with limited moisture brought some snow to the area January 5-6. While a few flurries were around during the early and mid-afternoon hours January 5th, the main area of light snow developed 7-10 PM. Scattered areas of light snow and flurries continued to move through the region, producing brief, light accumulations before tapering off and ending 1-4 AM January 6th. Temperatures were in the low 30s as snow fell.

Sleet/Rain Mix January 13-14

A storm system brought a mix of rain and sleet to the region January 13-14. Scattered areas of precipitation began moving into the area between 10 PM January 13th and 1 AM January 14th as a mixture of sleet and rain. This sleet/rain mix continued at times into the overnight hours before becoming all rain towards daybreak on the 14th. Despite temperatures 34-39 degrees, sleet was able to produce some minor accumulations, mainly on colder surfaces. Temperatures then held in the mid 30s for the remainder of the event as periods of rain and drizzle continued into the evening.

Snow Showers and Squalls January 30th

After some lingering flurries moved through shortly after daybreak, a few scattered areas of snow showers and squalls developed and moved through the region on January 30th, mainly between 10 AM and 4 PM. Though temperatures were 33-38 degrees, they dropped to near 32 degrees in any snow. Snow varied in intensity, with snow becoming briefly heavy in any squalls. Additionally, wind gusts of up to 20-30 mph occasionally occurred in some squalls. After snow passed, temperatures rose back into the mid 30s, allowing for repeated coatings into the afternoon. A few flurries lingered through 8 PM.

Brief Light Snow and Flurries January 31

During the pre-dawn hours on January 31, a weak disturbance passing north of the region brought a few scattered areas of flurries and pockets of sleet, mainly between 4-8 AM. Temperatures were in the upper 20s and low 30s as precipitation fell.

Snow showers February 16th

Between 12-3 AM February 16th, snow showers and flurries began across the region. Although most of the accumulating snow occurred after Midnight, a few flurries occurred as early as 9 PM on the 15th. While a majority of these snow showers and flurries only produced scattered areas of light snow, a few stronger snow showers had brief bursts of steadier, heavier snow. Scattered snow showers and flurries continued off-and-on through the morning before ending 9 AM - 12 PM. Most minor accumulations primarily occurred on colder surfaces. Temperatures were initially 28-32 degrees during the pre-dawn hours before rising into the low-to-mid 30s by midday.

Snow showers and Flurries March 2-3

A few snow showers and flurries moved through the area March 2-3. While a few scattered flurries began falling as early as 9 PM on the 2nd, the majority of snow showers and flurries fell from 3 AM to 2 PM on the 3rd. A few flurries were even able to linger into the evening hours. Most accumulations occurred on colder, grassy surfaces prior to daybreak with temperatures 29-35 degrees. As the day went on, a strong March sun lifted temperatures into the upper 30s and low 40s, restricting any additional minor daytime accumulations to only shaded, grassy surfaces.

Rain Ends as Snow March 10th

A storm system moved through the area during the morning hours on March 10th. This system mainly brought rain, but enough cold air filtered in as the storm was exiting to allow some of the rain to mix with and change over to snow between 5-8 AM. Some of the snow was able to produce some minor accumulations on colder, grassy surfaces. Later on, a few scattered snow showers and flurries returned and continued into the afternoon before tapering off during the evening hours. Temperatures were initially in the 40s before falling into the 30s as rain changed to snow. Temperatures then rose back into the 40s during the day and gradually fell into the low 30s after sunset.

Rain mixes with snow March 19th

Between 3-6 AM on March 19th, colder air filtering into the region from the north allowed for rain to mix with snow. Around daybreak, a period of mainly wet snow fell with temperatures 33-38 degrees. Wet snow was able to produce some minor accumulations on colder, elevated and grassy surfaces, especially when precipitation was mainly snow. A mix of snow and some rain continued at times through the pre-dawn hours before tapering off 7-10 AM.

Brief snow showers December 13th

Between 6-9 PM a few scattered snow showers and flurries moved through the region. These snow showers were mainly light and produced some minor accumulations, mainly on colder, grassy surfaces. Temperatures were 33-37 degrees.

Wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet January 8th

Beginning 11 AM to 2 PM on the 8th, a disturbance brought a mix of light freezing rain, drizzle and sleet to northern Virginia with temperatures 28-32 degrees. This light wintry mix continued at times before changing to mainly freezing rain/drizzle and becoming more intermittent and scattered in nature by mid-to-late afternoon as temperatures rose to 32-37 degrees. Intermittent freezing rain/drizzle began tapering off during the evening before ending for good 8-10 PM. Due to the prior stretch of cold weather, icing continued to occur despite temperatures rising above freezing.

Short period of snow early morning Jan 30

A cold front moved through the region early morning Jan 30, bringing snow to the region starting between 2 AM - 3:30 AM Jan 30. Snow was short lived, exiting the region between 3:30 AM and 4:30 AM Jan 30. Snow was generally light with a couple brief bursts of heavier snow. Temperatures were between 32 and 35 degrees during the event

Storm system brings wintry mix February 4th

Beginning 6-9 AM on the 4th, precipitation began moving into the area as snow with temperatures 30-34 degrees. By mid-to-late morning, the snow quickly changed to a mix of snow and sleet before becoming freezing rain, which persisted at times into the afternoon hours. As temperatures slowly rose above freezing, freezing rain transitioned to mainly plain rain, though pockets of freezing rain lingered in some areas. Despite temperatures rising just above freezing, a few spots continued to have icing, mainly on colder, elevated surfaces. Precipitation exited to the north and east during the evening hours, ending 6-8 PM.

Storm system brings brief freezing rain February 7th

Beginning 2-4 AM, scattered and intermittent precipitation began moving into the area. While a few sleet pellets fell at the onset, most of the precipitation fell as rain. In a few colder spots, temperatures were near 32 degrees which allowed for some brief and patchy icing, mainly on colder, elevated surfaces. Shortly after sunrise, temperatures rose above freezing everywhere, with only plain rain thereafter.

Snow showers and flurries March 16th

Between 6 and 9 AM on the 16th, an area of snow showers and flurries moved across northern Virginia. Any particular snow shower that went through was brief and didn't last for more than 30 minutes. The intensity of snow was mostly light outside of some briefly moderate bursts with only minor and scattered accumulations on colder, grassy surfaces. Temperatures were 32-37 degrees during snow.

Snow Showers and Squalls February 9th

After the storm system that affected the region earlier in the day departed, areas of flurries, scattered snow showers and brief squalls returned between 10 AM and 1 PM. These snow showers and brief squalls continued off and on through the afternoon before tapering off to scattered flurries and ending 8-11 PM. Combined with very gusty winds of 30-45 mph at times, some of the stronger snow showers and squalls even produced brief whiteout conditions with areas of blowing snow. Temperatures ranged from 25-30 degrees as snow fell.

Storm system brings light snow December 15th

A quick-moving, rapidly developing storm brought light snow to the region, which began 10 AM - 12 PM on the 15th. Mainly light snow, flurries and even some occasional snow grains and pellets fell throughout much of the afternoon before tapering off and ending 3 - 5 PM. Temperatures were 27 - 31 degrees as snow fell.

Clipper system brings snow December 30th

Between 12-3 AM on the 30th, light snow began falling across northern Virginia with temperatures in the upper teens and low 20s. Periods of light to moderate snow continued through the overnight hours before tapering off 4-6 AM with a few flurries lingering through 7-8 AM. Shortly after noon, flurries and a few widely scattered snow showers returned as temps rose into the mid-upper 20s to near 32. Flurries continued off-and-on through the afternoon before coming to an end during the evening hours.

Storm system brings light snow to NE Virginia

     A storm system moved in from the northwest, bringing snow to the area begining 12 - 3 AM Jan 17.  Intermittent light snow (<0.25"/hr) continued until between 7 AM -  10 AM.  Temperatures fell from the mid 30s into the mid 20s through the event.

Initial period of wintry mix on March 20th.

Morning rain on the 20th began to mix with sleet at times beginning 12 - 2PM as temperatures settled to 31 – 34 degrees. This mix continued through the afternoon and evening, briefly mixing with snow at times too. After 9PM, this wintry mix tapered too mainly drizzle and pockets of freezing drizzle as temperatures held near 32 degrees. A brief lull in precipitation followed shortly after Midnight as drier air moved in.

This report reflects any wintry precipitation through around Midnight. Another steadier period of snow developed during the early morning of the 21st, which will be covered in a separate report.

Storm System Brings Wintry Mix of Rain, Snow & Sleet March 6-7

With temperatures initially in the low-mid 40s, areas of rain began pushing into the region between 6-8 PM on the 6th. Soon after rain began, temperatures then quickly cooled to 34-38 degrees which allowed for rain to mix with sleet and snow. Mixed precipitation then changed to a brief period of mainly light snow, producing some minor accumulations on colder, grassy surfaces. Towards or shortly after midnight, any remaining snow changed back over to rain before ending 12-2 AM.

Storm system brings snow & sleet February 17th

Combinations of snow, rain & sleet began moving into the area between 1 - 3 PM with temperatures 37 - 42 degrees. As temperatures cooled to 32 - 34 degrees, mixed precipitation became predominantly snow which quickly became moderate at times during the mid-to-late afternoon hours. As intensity of precip began to lighten up late in the day, sleet and rain began mixing in again before finally changing to all rain and ending 7 - 9 PM.

Western edge of coastal storm impacts region January 3-4th

As a strong nor'easter rapidly strengthened off the mid-Atlantic coast during the late evening on the 3rd, areas of snow began moving into the region between 10 PM and 1 AM though places closer to the VA/MD border started as late as 2-4 AM. Areas of steadier light to occasionally moderate snow continued into the early daylight hours before becoming more intermittent with variable intensity by mid-morning. Lingering snow gradually tapered off to flurries from west to east, ending between 11 AM and 2 PM. In addition to the light-to-moderate intensity of the snow, winds increased to 15-25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph during and after the storm. Temperatures were mainly in the low-mid 20s throughout the event. 

The strong winds led to blowing and drifting snow, which resulted in substantial variability of snow accumulation and higher-than-normal drifts.

Coastal Storm Brings Snow January 7th

As a coastal system passed by southeast of the region on January 7th, areas of flurries began to develop between 3-6 AM. The flurries were intermittent at first, but eventually developed into a steadier, light snow during the mid to late morning hours. Toward mid-day, a band of more moderate snow passed through the region before tapering back to flurries. Snow ended across the region between 1-4 PM. Temperatures during the snow were 18-24 degrees.

Storm System Brings Snow January 29-30

A storm system passing through the area brought areas of snow January 29-30. Precipitation began falling as early as 7-10 PM on the 29th as intermittent flurries or some sprinkles/light rain with temperatures between 34-38 degrees. However, any rain changed to all snow shortly after Midnight on the 30th as temperatures fell into the upper 20s and low 30s. A steadier area of snow arrived during the pre-dawn hours, producing some briefly moderate/heavy snowfall before tapering off and ending 4-7 AM. After that, a few areas of flurries returned during the mid-morning hours.

Coastal storm brings first snow of the season

A potent coastal system brought snow to the area on December 9th. While precipitation initially started off as some flurries or even sprinkles during the pre-dawn hours, it quickly became all snow which began developing across the area between 5-8 AM and continued falling into the afternoon & evening. The intensity of snowfall was mainly light to moderate but did become heavy at times, especially during the mid-to-late morning hours. Snow gradually tapered off and ended between 5-8 PM. Temperatures mainly held between 28-34 degrees as snow fell.

A significant coastal storm produced heavy mixed precipitation on March 13-14

With temperatures starting from 33-37 degrees, scattered light snow (mixed with rain in some spots at onset) developed over the area between 5-8 PM on the 13th. Over the next few hours, snow became steady before transitioning to combinations of snow, sleet, freezing rain and rain after Midnight on the 14th. With temperatures that generally remained steady, this wintry mix became increasingly heavy during the pre-dawn hours. From 7-10 AM, mixed precipitation gradually lightened and became scattered. Towards noon, a final band of snow pushed through the area as the temperature slightly warmed to 30-35 degrees. Later on, a few scattered areas of flurries returned which lingered into the late evening. During the extended period of heavy mixed precipitation, sleet amounted up to 1 inch in some spots. With sleet being generally three to four times more dense than snow, this led to an extremely heavy and dense snow/sleet pack relative to the overall accumulation. Further weight was added to this overall accumulation on the ground with the addition of the rain and freezing rain. 


Accumulation in the "Total" column are representative of combined non-compacted snow and sleet accumulation per standard snow measurement guidelines. Accumulation listed under "Ice" indicates any additional ice accretion from freezing rain only, if applicable.

Steady snow returned on March 21st.

After a brief lull overnight, a light wintry mix of freezing drizzle, light sleet and snow returned between 4 – 6AM on the 21st. After 6AM, this turned to all snow, and became moderate to heavy through the morning and midday with snowfall rates around 1” per hour at times. Snow lightened in the afternoon and ended 4 – 7PM. Just a few flurries returned around Midnight. Temperatures through the event were 32 – 35 degrees, resulting in a wet snowfall.

Wintry Mix Impacts Area December 17th, 2016

With temperatures in the low to mid 20s, light snow developed over the area between 1-4am on December 17th. Snow increased in intensity and became steady at times after 5am as temperatures were in the mid to upper 20s. As warmer air above the surface moved into the area, snow transitioned to a sleet and freezing rain mix between 6-8am. Eventually, any mix turned to areas of freezing rain before becoming light and very scattered between 10am-Noon. Temperatures quickly climbed to 35-40 degrees after noon and into the 40s for the remainder of the day ending any ice threat.

Snow Showers Develop on January 30th, 2017

With temperatures in the lower 30s, a disturbance produced scattered snow showers across the area between 2-9pm. Winds gusted 20-30 mph at times during the snow showers. After snow showers exited, temperatures fell into the 20s overnight.

Disturbance Brings Freezing Rain on January 8th

Between 4-6pm, areas of rain arrived across the area with temperatures ranging 33-36 degrees on January 8th. As precipitation overspread the area, temperatures fell to 32-34 across all areas and in addition to a previous cold stretch rain changed over to freezing rain. Freezing rain then continued, intermittent at times into the evening, before ending between 9-11pm. Temperatures remained steady 32-34 degrees after precipitation exited.

Rain Changes to Snow on January 17th

As a disturbance moved into the region from the west, areas of rain developed between 1-4am across the area on January 17th with temperatures ranging in the upper 30s to lower 40s. Cooler air and more moisture from a developing low pressure system off the coast caused rain to mix then transition to snow between 6-10am. Snow continued before ending 1-4pm as temperatures fell to 28-32 degrees. Temperatures remained steady before falling into the mid 20s around sunset.

Late Morning/Early Afternoon Snow Showers on February 2nd

With temperatures in the upper 20s, scattered snow showers and flurries moved through the area between 10am-1pm on February 2nd. Temperatures remained steady after snow showers exited as winds gusted 20-30 mph.

Powerful Coastal Storm Brings Snow, Rain and Wind

A very strong Nor'easter brought heavy precipitation to the region on March 2nd. A good portion of the precipitation fell as rain with temperatures starting in the upper 30s. Between 3-10 pm rain mixed and periodically changed to periods of snow. Any snow tapered down to flurries and sprinkles and ending 10pm-1am. When wintry precipitation was falling, the temperature was between 34 and 38 degrees and held in that range after precpitation ended. In addition to the precipitation, winds were quite strong. Gusts were frequently 40-50 mph, with some spots exceeding 60 mph at times.

Snow/Sleet Mix on March 20th

With temperatures in the mid-upper 30s, areas of mixed rain and sleet moved into the region between 9am-12pm on March 20th. As precipitation became steady, rain mixed and changed to snow and sleet during the afternoon as temperatures ranged from 33-35 degrees. Steady precipitation exited between 5-8pm, with lingering drizzle and flurries remaining into the evening as temperatures ranged from 34-37 degrees.

Coastal System Brings Areas of Snow Overnight January 29th-30th

Temperatures began in the upper 30s to 40 as precipitation arrived during the evening on January 29th as rain showers. Precipitation mixed then transitioned to snow between 10pm-2am into January 30th as temperatures settled into the low to mid 30s. Areas of light snow continued overnight before tapering to flurries and ending 3-6am with temperatures 30-35 degrees. Any additional snow showers that followed for the rest of the day will be handled in another report.

Disturbance Produces Snow Showers and Squalls on January 30th

With temperatures 33-37 degrees, snow showers and flurries developed between 8-11am on January 30th. Embedded in snow showers, were snow squalls, which included steadier bursts of snow and wind gusts 20-30 mph. Temperatures fell to 28-32 degrees as snow showers continued into the afternoon. Any snow showers and flurries diminished 5-8pm with temperatures continuing to fall into the 20s during the evening.

Coastal Storm Hits Area on February 9th, 2017

With temperatures starting 37-42 degrees, steady rain developed across the region after midnight on February 9th. As colder air filtered in, rain mixed with sleet and snow between 5-7am. The mix transitioned to snow between 7-9am, which was moderate to heavy at times into the morning. Winds also became quite gusty with wind gusts 30-40 mph as temperatures fell into the lower 30s. Moderate to heavy snow tapered to light snow and flurries and ended between 12pm-3pm with temperatures remaining steady in the upper 20s to lower 30s into the afternoon. Wind gusts increased to 40-50 mph after snow ended into the evening which caused some blowing and drifting of snow with temperatures falling into the upper teens to lower 20s overnight.

Snow Showers and Squalls Affect Area on March 15th, 2017

With temperatures ranging from 25-30 degrees, scattered snow showers and flurries moved across the region starting 11am-2pm on March 15th. Winds were also quite gusty, ranging from 30-40 mph. Through the afternoon, isolated snow squalls developed along with the snow showers. Contained with these squalls were white-out conditions, wind gusts to 40-45 mph, and heavy snow. Between 6-9pm, any snow showers and flurries exited with temperatures falling to the low to mid 20s overnight.

Coastal Storm Brings Snow Early on March 13th

With temperatures ranging from 34-38 degrees, areas of mixed rain and snow showers which were around during the late evening on March 12th changed over to all snow between 1-4am on March 13th. Temperatures remained steady as snow continued through the morning hours with winds gusting 25-35 mph. Snow tapered to flurries and ended 9-11am with temperatures rising into the 40s through the afternoon.Due to the marginal temperatures during the event, accumulation was mainly confined to colder surfaces.

Light Snow with Storm System January 5-6, 2017

With temperatures starting in the lower 30s, light snow developed across the area starting 6-9pm. Snow remained light and intermittent overnight before ending 4-7AM with temperatures remaining steady into the morning.

Snow with Clipper System Late December 13th into 14th

Starting 8-11pm from December 13th a clipper system brought snow into the region. Snow was light to moderate overnight into December 14th as temperatures ranged between 24-30 degrees. Snow became intermittent after 1-3am, lulling to flurries at times. Any lingering flurries and snow showers came to an end between 6-9am as temperatures held 24-30 degrees. After snow ended, temperature rose into the upper 30s to lower 40s during the afternoon with wind gusts 20-30 mph.

A period of snow with late-day squalls

Coming off a day with temperatures well into the 60s, is was a mild start for the beginning of a winter event on the 10th. What began as light rain transitioned to steady snow between 7-10AM. Temperatures fell through the lower-40s and upper-30s, reaching 32-35 degrees during the height of the event. Steady snow persisted through the morning hours before tapering off between 12-2:30PM. Temperatures recovered to near 40 during the afternoon. Close on the heels of this snow, additional snow showers and squalls impacted the area from 5:30PM-midnight. Some of these squalls produced heavy snow for a brief period leading to additional minor accumulations. Increasing northwest winds, sustained at 10-18mph with gusts 25-30, ushered in very cold air dropping temperatures into the low-20s at night.

Low Pressure System Produces Steady Snow in the Early Morning on January 30th, 2017

With temperatures ranging from 30-35 degrees, area of light snow across the area between 1-4am as a low pressure system moved just south of the area. Snow became moderate to heavy at times through the early morning before tapering to flurries and ending 7-10am with tempeartures in the lower 30s.

Coastal Storm Brings Snow on December 15

As a coastal storm developed out to sea, snow overspread the area between 1-4 PM on December 15th, and became steady during the late afternoon and evening rush hour, with intervals of moderate snow. At the onset of snow, temperatures were in the upper 20s, but settled into the mid 20s as snow became steady. The snow tapered to flurries and came to an end between 6-9 PM. After snow ended, temperatures fell into the upper teens to lower 20s overnight.

Rain and Snow with Powerful Coastal Storm on March 7th

After rain occurred during the overnight and morning hours, cooler air filtered into the region on March 7th between 12-6pm causing rain to change to areas of snow, which was heavy at times. This caused temperatures to fall to 33-36 degrees during snowfall and with a powerful coastal storm off the coast winds gusted 40-55 mph with thunder and lightning. After bands of steady to heavy snow exited, any lingering flurries and light snow diminished 7-11pm with temperatures settling 32-36 degrees overnight.

First Widespread Snowfall of the Season on December 8th and 9th

A coastal system moved up the coast and brought snow over the area on December 8th into the 9th. Flurries and intermittent pockets of light snow first began starting 6-9 PM on December 8th as temperatures fell from the upper 30s down to 33-35 degrees. Snow remained light and intermittent overnight as temperatures held 33-35 degrees. Starting 6-9am on December 9th, snow became moderate at times and remained light to moderate into the morning and afternoon as temperatures fell to 30-33. After 2pm, snow began to mix with rain and sleet at times with variable precipitation types as temperatures held 33-34 degrees. Any mix changed back to light to moderate snow before ending 12-3am into December 10th as temperatures fell into the upper 20s to lower 30 overnight. Pavement accumulation was variable and generally less than colder surfaces during the daytime.

Clipper System Brings Snow on December 30th

With temperatures ranging from 18-23 degrees, light snow and flurries developed over the region between 6-8am on December 30th as a clipper system moved through the region. Temperatures remained steady as light, to at times steady, snow continued into the morning. Between 11am-1pm, a heavier band of snow developed producing 0.5-1" per hour rates. Widespread snow quickly exited by 2pm, though intermittent snow showers and flurries remained through 4-7pm before ending with temperatures in the mid 20s.

Major Coastal Storm Impacts Area on January 7th, 2017

With temperatures steady in the lower 20s for the entire period, areas of light snow moved into the area between 4-7am on January 7th. Due to the cold, dry airmass in place snow was of a dry and powdery nature. Snow became moderate to heavy at times into the afternoon producing whiteout conditions and 1-2" per hour snowfall rates. Winds gusted 20-30 mph during the event which cause significant blowing and drifting. Snow tapered to flurries before ending 4-7pm as the coastal system exited east.

Rain to Snow with Coastal Storm on March 21st

Temperatures started 34-38 degrees with areas of rain through the morning on March 21st. Snow mixed in at times through the early afternoon, before steadier precipitation arrived between 1-4pm as a coastal storm developed east. Snow fell steady to heavy at times through the evening before tapering to flurries and light snow 10pm-1am and ending 2-4am. Temperatures fell to 32-34 during snowfall, but rose to 33-35 degrees after snow ended. In  addition, winds gusted to 25-35 mph.

Major Coastal Storm Brings Heavy Snow and Wind January 3rd into the 4th

With temperatures starting 28-32 degrees, areas of light snow arrived into the area between 9pm-12am on January 3rd into the 4th. Bands of steadier to heavy snow developed overnight as winds increased gusting to 30-40 mph. Temperatures fell to 25-30 degrees by daybreak as snow became heavy with 1-3"/hr rates and blizzard-like conditions. Strong winds continued into the morning with gusts 40-50 mph as heavy snow continued as temperatures fell into the mid-upper 20s. Snow became more intermittent and lighter between 12-3pm, with any areas of lingering snow coming to an end 5-8pm. Strong winds with gusts 35-50 mph continued into the overnight as temperatures fell into the low to mid 20s.

The combination of strong winds, heavy snow and a long period of cold weather made this a high-impact storm. Winds in particular led to significant blowing and drifting, which resulted in substantial variability of snow accumulation and higher-than-normal drifts.

Brief Period of Light Snow

A brief period of light snow moved through the area between 4:30 and 6:00 AM December 15th. Temperatures ranged from 28 - 32 degrees.

Ocean Effect Snow Showers/Flurries

A few ocean effect snow showers and flurries moved through the area between 12:00 and 6:00 PM December 19th. Temperatures ranged from 28 - 32 degrees throughout the event.

Periods of Light Snow January 14 - 15th

Periods of light snow and flurries moved through the area between 9:00 PM January 14th and 1:00 AM January 15th. Temperatures ranged from 30 - 34 degrees.

Brief Snow Shower Moves Through

A brief snow shower moved through the area between 11:00 AM and 2:00 PM February 2nd. Temperatures ranged from 33 - 37 degrees.

Scattered Snow Showers March 3 - 4 

A few snow showers and flurries moved through the area between 7:00 PM March 3rd and 1:00 AM March 4th. Temperatures were steady in the low to mid 20s. Strong northwest winds gusted to 35 - 45 mph at times.

Periods of Rain and Snow March 19th    

A mix of rain and snow entered the area between 5:00 and 8:00 AM March 19th. The rain and snow continued through the afternoon, before tapering off 7:00 to 10:00 PM that evening. Temperatures ranged from 33 - 38 degrees throughout the event.

Coastal System Brings Brief Period of Wintry Mix

A mix of rain, sleet, and wet snow fell between 7:00 AM and 1:00 PM December 9th, with temperatures ranging from 34 - 36 degrees. As warmer air moved into the area, precipitation changed to all rain by the afternoon.

Ocean Effect Snow Showers

A few ocean effect snow showers moved through the area between 6:00 and 11:00 AM January 1st. Temperatures ranged from 5 - 10 degrees.

Ocean Effect Snow Showers/Flurries January 14th

A few ocean effect snow showers and flurries entered the area between 6:00 and 8:00 AM January 14th. The snow continued intermittently through the day, before ending between 3:00 and 5:00 PM that afternoon. Temperatures were steady in the low to mid 20s throughout the event.

Upper Level Disturbance Brings Snow Shower February 6th

A few flurries and snow showers moved through the area between 10:00 AM and 1:00 PM February 6th. Temperatures ranged from 25 - 30 degrees.

Rain Ends as Brief Period of Wet Snow

Light rain and sleet entered the area between 3:00 and 5:00 PM February 22nd. As colder air moved in, the rain and sleet changed to wet snow between 5:00 and 7:00 PM that evening.Temperatures began in the upper 30s, but fell to near 32 by the end of the event.

Post-Coastal Storm Snow Showers March 14 - 15th

A period of light snow moved through the area between 11:00 PM March 14th and 4:00 AM March 15th Temperatures ranged from 32 - 34 degrees.

Rain and Snow Showers March 25th

Scattered rain and snow showers moved through the area between 1:00 and 7:00 AM March 25th. Some additional, non-accumulating snow showers continued into the afternoon. Temperatures ranged from 33 - 37 degrees.

Rain Changes to Heavy Snow Christmas Day

Light rain entered the area between 1:00 and 3:00 AM December 25th with temperatures in the upper 30s. Much colder air rushed into the area between 9:00 and 10:00 AM, changing precipitation to all snow with temperatures falling to near 30. During the transition to snow, westerly winds briefly gusted to 60 - 70 mph. The snow became briefly heavy at times, before tapering off 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM.

Brief Shot of Snow January 8 - 9th

A brief period of snow moved through the area between 11:00 PM January 8th and 1:00 AM January 9th. Temperatures ranged from 32 - 34 degrees. Some sleet and rain mixed with the snow at times, especially at the onset.

Snow Changes to Rain February 17 - 18th

Steady snow entered the area between 8:00 and 10:00 PM February 17th. The snow quicky became moderate at times during the evening, before changing to rain between 11:00 PM that evening and 1:00 AM February 18th. Temperatures began between 32 - 34 degrees, but rose to the upper 30s and lower 40s after the changeover.

Periods of Light to Moderate Snow March 4 - 5th

A steady light to moderate snow entered the area between 9:00 and 11:00 PM March 4th. The snow continued through the overnight, before tapering off between 8:00 and 10:00 AM March 5th. The snow mixed with some rain at times, especially at the onset and towards the end. Temperatures ranged from 32 - 36 degrees throughout the event.

Snow Changes to Rain April 6th

A brief period of snow moved through the area between 12:00 and 5:00 PM April 6th, before changing to all rain. Temperatures were in the mid 30s during the snow. Due to warm ground temperatures, most of the snow accumulation occurred on non-paved surfaces.

Brief Period of Snow Changes to Rain

A brief period of snow moved through the area between 8:00 PM December 11th and 12:00 AM December 12th, before precipitation changed to rain. Temperutres ranged from 32 - 34 degrees during the snowfall.

Ocean Effect Snow Returns January 15th

Light snow netered the area between 9:00 and 11:00 AM January 15th. The snow continued intermittently through 11:00 PM January 15th and 2:00 AM January 16th, mixing with a bit of freezing rain at times. Temperatures ranged from 29 - 32 degrees throughout the event.

Rain Ends as Wet Snow March 8th

Periods of heavy rain ended with some periods of wet snow between 4:00 and 10:00 AM March 8th. Some places ended mixed with rain again. Temperatures began in the upper 30s when the snow began, but fell to 32 - 34 by the end of the event.

Potent Coastal Storm Brings Rain and Snow

Rain moved into the area between 5:00 and 7:00 AM January 4th with temperatures in the to upper 30s. As colder air rushed into the area, the rain changed to snow with temperatures falling to 32 - 34 degrees. The snow continued through the afternoon, before tapering off between 7:00 and 9:00 PM that evening. Strong north winds gusted to 60 - 70 mph. By the time the snow ended, temperatures had fallen into the upper 20s, allowing any wet/slushy areas to quickly become icy.

Rain Ends as Period of Wet Snow February 2nd

Periods of rain changed to snow between 6:00 and 8:00 AM February 2nd. The snow continued through 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM that same day. Temperatures began in the mid 30s, but fell into the upper 20s by the end of the event.

Coastal System Brings Mix of Rain and Wet Snow March 21-22nd

A mix of rain and wet snow entered the area between 1:00 and 3:00 PM March 21st with temperatures in the mid to upper 30s. The mixture continued to fall through the overnight, before changing to mostly snow during the morning hours on March 22nd. When the precipitation changed to all snow, temperatures fell to 33 - 35 degrees. The snow came to an end between 1:00 and 3:00 PM March 22nd.

Major Nor'easter Brings Snow and Rain

Intermittent periods of snow moved into the area between 7:00 and 9:00 AM March 14th with temperatures in the low 30s. The snow became steadier and heavier by late morning, before quickly changing to sleet and rain between 10:00 and 11:00 AM. Periods of heavy rain continued through 6:00 to 9:00 PM that evening. Once the rainfall ended, temperatures fell back below freezing overnight, allowing wet surfaces to refreeze. NE winds gusted to 50 - 60 mph at times.

Rain Changes to Snow February 15 -16th

Rain changed to snow between 9:00 PM February 15th and 12:00 AM February 16th. A steady snow continued through the early morning hours on the 16th, before ending 8:00 to 11:00 AM. Temperatures began in the mid 30s, but fell to near 32 by the end of the event.

Fast Moving Storm Brings April Snow

A steady snow entered the area between 7:00 and 9:00 AM April 2nd. The snow became moderate to heavy at times during the mid-morning, before ending between 12:00 and 2:00 PM that same day. Temperatures ranged from 31 - 34 degrees. Due to warm pavement temperatures, most of the snow accumulation occurred on colder, non-paved surfaces.

Coastal System Brings Rain and Snow

Snow showers entered the area between between 12:00 and 3:00 AM February 12th. The snow quickly changed to rain with temperatures rising into the mid 30s. Periods of rain continued through the 12th, before changing back to snow between 3:00 and 6:00 AM February 13th with temperatures falling into the upper 20s. Periods of moderate to heavy snow continued through 5:00 to 8:00 PM that evening. Strong NW winds of 45 - 55 mph caused significant blowing and drifting snow.

Clipper System Brings Light Snow December 30th

A steady light snow entered the area between 1:00 and 3:00 PM December 30th. The steady snow continued through 9:00 to 11:00 PM that evening. Temperatures were steady between 17 - 22 degrees throughout the event.

Coastal Storm Brings Snow December 15th

Light snow entered the area between 5:00 and 7:00 December 15th. The snow quickly became moderate at times through the evening, before tapering off between 1:00 and 3:00 AM December 16th. Temperatures were steady between 28 - 32 for most of the event, before falling into the 20s after the snow ended.

Periods of Snow February 10-11th

Periods of snow moved into the area between 10:00 PM February 10th and 1:00 AM February 11th. The snow continued through 4:00 to 7:00 AM February 11th. Temperatures were steady between 19 - 24 degrees throughout the event.

Clipper System Brings Light Snowfall December 14th

Snow entered the area between 3:00 and 5:00 AM December 14th. The snow became moderate at times before ending 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM that same day. Temperatures ranged from 23 - 27 degrees.

Period of Moderate to Heavy Snow Changes to Rain

A steady snow entered the area between 1:00 and 3:00 AM December 17th with temperatures in the low 20s. The snow became heavy at times towards sunrise, before changing to a mix of rain and freezing rain between 7:00 and 9:00 AM.  Precipitation changed to all rain before ending 2:00 - 4:00 PM that afternoon.

Clipper System Brings Snowfall

Periods of snow entered the area between 12:00 and 3:00 PM January 31st. The snow continued to fall, heavy at times, through 12:00 to 3:00 AM February 1st. Temperatures were steady between 24 - 29 degrees for most of the event, but warmed to 32 - 34 after midnight. The snow mixed with some rain at times.

Snow Changes to Rain January 17th

A steady light to moderate snow entered the area between 12:00 and 2:00 AM January 17th. The snow continued through the morning hours, before mixing with, and changing to rain between 7:00 and 9:00 AM that same day. Temperatures began between 32 - 34, but rose into the mid 30s as precipitation changed to rain.

Coastal Storm Brings Heavy Snow January 29 - 30th

A mix of rain and snow entered the area between 7:00 and 9:00 PM January 29th. Any mixed precipitation quickly changed to all snow between 2:00 and 4:00 AM January 30th. The snow continued through sunrise, becoming moderate to heavy at times during the mid to late morning hours. The snow came to an end between 3:00 and 5:00 PM that evening. Temperatures began in the mid 30s, but fell to 24 - 27 degrees by the end of the event.

Snowfall early on the 6th.

Flurries began after 1AM, with steadier snow arriving 3 - 5AM on the 6th. This turned moderate to heavy at times through the morning, before ending 11AM - 12PM. Temperatures through the event held 25 - 30 degrees, resulting in a fluffy snowfall.

Coastal System Brings Heavy Snow

A steady snow entered the area between 4:00 and 7:00 AM March 10th. The snow became moderate to heavy at times during the afternoon and evening, with snowfall rates reaching 1" per hour at times. The steadiest snow came to an end between 7:00 and 10:00 PM that evening, but intermittent snow showers continued through 2:00 to 5:00 AM March 11th.. Temperatures ranged from 28 - 32 degrees throughout the event.

Note: The snow totals contained in this report are representative of official snow measuring surfaces (a white snow board). Due to marginal temperatures and March conditions, pavement accumulations were generally less, and subject to considerable variations.

Another Major Coastal Storm March 13th.

Initial light rain showers began as early as 12AM, before becoming a steady snow by 3 - 4AM on the 13th as temperatures settled from the upper 30s to near 32 degrees. Snow quickly became moderate to heavy through the storm, with the peak between 7AM - 7PM when snowfall rates of 1 - 2" per hour occurred. The main area of snow ended by 10PM, though intermittent light snow lingered until 12AM on the 14th. Temperatures during snowfall were 32 - 34 degrees, and winds gusted 50 - 80 mph, resulting in blizzard conditions.

Coastal Storm Brings Blizzard Conditions February 9th

Light rain changed to snow between 11:00 AM and 1:00 PM February 9th. The snow quickly became heavy during the afternoon, with snowfall rates reaching 2 - 3" per hour in the heaviest bands. The snow lightened up during the early evening, before ending 9:00 to 11:00 PM. Strong northerly winds of 50 - 60 mph caused significant blowing and drifting, resulting in white-out conditions. Temperatures began in the mid 30s, but fell into the low 20s by the end of the event.

Coastal System Brings Blizzard Conditions

After a few morning flurries, a steady snow entered the area between 9:00 and 11:00 AM January 7th. The snow quickly became moderate to heavy at times during the afternoon and evening. Snowfall rates reached 1-2" per hour in the heaviest bands of snow. The snow gradually came to an end between 3:00 and 5:00 AM January 8th. Gusty winds of 40 - 50 mph caused some significant blowing and drifting snow. Temperatures ranged from 25 - 29 degrees for most of the event, but fell into the low 20s as the snow was ending.

Wintry Mix and Freezing Rain Event December 17, 2016

Starting between 2am and 4am on December 17, 2016 with temperatures in the mid 20s, mainly sleet moved into the region and fell steadily for a period before mixing with and changing over to freezing rain by 4am to 6am. Freezing rain continued steadily into the morning hours as temperatures remained in the mid - upper 20s. Due to the antecedent cold air mass preceding this event, all surfaces received significant icing during this event. Freezing rain exited the region between 10am and 12pm with temperatures around 30 degrees.

Scattered snow showers and squalls on December 30

On strong northwest winds, a few scattered snow showers and snow squallsmoved through the region on December 30th. The snow showers and squalls began to affect the area between 6-9AM and continued intermittently into the afternoon, tapering off between 4-7PM.
