A brief period of light snow moved into the area between 2 - 4 PM on November 27th. The light snow quickly came to an end by 7 PM that evening. Temperatures were between 35 - 38 degrees during the brief event.

Light Snow on December 3rd and 4th

Light snow moved into the area between 2 - 5 AM on December 3rd. Periods of light snow and flurries continued throughout the day as temperatures held in the mid 30s. Scattered snow showers and flurries persisted during the overnight hours and into the morning of December 4th. The last of the snow showers exited the area by noon on the 4th as temperatures were near 32 degrees.

Snow Showers and Flurries on December 10th

A period of flurries entered the area between 8 - 11 AM on December 10th. The flurries gave way to light snow showers throughout the afternoon before coming to an end by 11 PM that night. Temperatures during the event were between 20 - 24 degrees.

Brief Freezing Rain

A period of freezing rain fell in locations between 12 - 5 AM on December 18th. Temperatures were between 30 - 32 degrees during this time. Temperatures rose above 32 degrees in all locations after 5 AM transitioning the freezing rain to plain rain.
A brief period of light snow showers and flurries fell in the area between 4 - 7 AM on December 24th. Temperatures during the brief event were between 32- 36 degrees.

Wintry Mix on December 26th

A scattered light mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain began in the area between 11 AM - 2 PM on December 26th. Temperatures began in the upper 20s as the precipitation continued intermittently through the day. By 6 - 9 PM, temperatures rose into the mid-30s and any remaining precipitation transitioned to plain rain.

Brief Snow on New Year's

A brief period of light snow fell in the area between 2 - 7 AM on January 1st with a few lingering flurries occurring for a few hours after. Temperatures during the event were between 32 - 36 degrees.

Rain and wintry mix on January 3rd - 4th

Rain transitioned to a brief period of snow, sleet, and freezing rain during the overnight of January 3rd into the 4th. The wintry precipitation was light and came to an end between 3 - 6 AM on the 4th with temperatures between 33 - 36 degrees.
A brief period of light snow showers and flurries fell between 10 PM on January 5th and 3 AM on the 6th. Temperatures held between 22 - 26 degrees during the brief snowfall.

Flurries early on the 13th.

Occasional flurries and brief snow showers fell early on the 13th. This began as early as 3 - 6AM, and ended by 10 or 11AM. Temperatures during this time cooled from the mid-30s to the upper 20s as wind increased, gusting to 25 - 40 mph.

Snow showers on the 2nd

Following a mild early morning with temperatures in the 40s, snow showers entered the area between 5 - 8 AM on March 2nd as temperatures began to quickly fall. Snow showers continued intermittently through the morning and early afternoon before ending by 12 - 3 PM. Temperatures fell to the low to mid-20s by the end of the event with winds gusting to 25 - 35 mph.

Brief wintry mix overnight of March 6th - 7th

A mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain began on March 6th between 7 - 10 PM with temperatures between 32 - 35 degrees. The wintry mix continued at times overnight into the 7th before ending between 1 - 4 AM. Temperatures began to rise to the upper 30s after this period.

Scattered snow showers and flurries

An Arctic front swept across northern Vermont during the evening hours of November 9th.  After some rain showers (and some thunder), scattered snow showers fell across the area between midnight and 6 AM on November 10th.  The snow showers were accompanied by wind gusts over 40 mph.  Additional scattered snow showers and flurries fell through the morning before ending during the early afternoon hours on the 10th.  Most accumualtions were confined to colder and non-paved surfaces and was elevation sensitive.  Temperatures were in the low to mid 30s around midnight before falling into the upper teens and low 20s as the snow showers exited the area.

A period of wet snow, then flurries

Rain changed to a period of wet snow and snow showers that fell between 11 AM - 4 PM on November 22nd.  Additonal scattered snow flurries fell during the overnight with little or no additonal accumulaion.  Temperatures were 32 - 35 when the rain changed to snow, then fell into the 20s by morning.

Overnight Snow Showers

Flurries and scattered light snow showers fell across the area between 9 PM, December 15th and 3 AM, December 16th.  Temperatures ranged from the single digits (higher elevations) to the low and mid teens.

On & Off Snow Showers

Scattered flurries along with a few light snow showers fell across much of northern Vermont during the morning hours of December 16th.  However, a more widespread band of snow showers (along with a few heavier squalls) fell between 11 AM - 5 PM later on the 16th. A few more flurries continued through the evening before completely ending by Midnight of December 17th.  Temperatures were mainly in the teens, but a few locations in the higher elevations remained in the single digits.

Another Round Of Snow Showers

Intermittent flurries and scattered snow showers fell across parts of northern New Hampshire between 9 AM - 5 PM on December 26th.  Temperatures were mainly in the single digits (teens in some valley locations) through the day.

Light Snow And Flurries

Periods of light snow continued to fall early on January 18th through the late morning hours as a disturbance finally exited the area.  Occasional flurries dotted the landscape for most of the afternoon, but scattered light snow showers returned between Midnight - 5 AM on January 19th.  Temperatures were in the low teens to start out the 18th, then held in the mid to upper teens for the overnight snow showers.

Afternoon Wintry Mix

A period of light freezing rain (mixed with sleet at times) fell across the area between Noon - 4 PM on February 11th.  Temperatures ranged 28 - 32 degrees.

Overnight Flurries

Scattered flurries along with a brief snow shower streaked across the area between 1 - 4 AM on March 25th.  Temperatures were in the mid to upper 20s.

Snow showers and flurries on the 30th

Occasional snow showers and flurries began in the area between 8 - 11 AM on January 30th. Flurries continued very intermittently through the afternoon hours before ending as a brief snow shower between 5 - 8 PM later that evening. Temperatures during the event were between 15 - 20 degrees.

Flurries and scattered snow showers

Scattered snow showers fell across parts of northern Vermont between 4 - 11 AM on December 7th.  There were additional flurries into the early afternoon.  This was followed by another round of scattered snow showers between 9 PM later on the 7th to 3 AM on December 8th.  Temperatures ranged 28 - 33 degrees with the daytime snow showers, but fell into the low to mid 20s with the second round of snow early on the 8th.

Coastal Storm Produces A Period Of Snow

A period of light snow fell across much of northwest Vermont between 6 PM, December 9th and Midnight, December 10th.  Temperatures ranged 27 - 32 degrees.

A Few Light Snow Showers

Flurries and scattered light snow showers moved across parts of northern Vermont between 11 AM - 4 PM on December 31st.  Temperatures ranged -5 to 5 degrees.

Evening Snow Showers

Occasional flurries fell during the late morning and afternoon hours of April 10th.  This was followed by scattered snow showers that moved across the area between 5 - 8 PM later on the 10th.  Temperatures were in the mid to upper 30s during the afternoon, but fell to 32 - 35 degrees by evening.  Due to warm pavement temperatures, most of the snow accumulation occurred on colder, non-paved surfaces.
A brief period of light snow fell between 3 - 9 AM on December 14th. Temperatures during the event were between 28 - 32 degrees.

Light snow showers and flurries fell in the area between 9 AM - 2 PM on December 24th with temperatures between 32 - 36 degrees. Rain mixed with the snow at times before temperatures rose into the upper 30s and changed the precipitation to all rain.

Snow showers overnight of January 4th to 5th

A mix of intermittent snow and rain showers began in the area by 2 - 5 PM on January 4th with temperatures in the mid-30s. Brief periods of scattered snow showers continued overnight into the 5th as temperatures fell into the low to mid-20s. Any lingering snow showers and flurries came to an end by 1 - 4 AM on January 5th.

Snow showers and flurries on the 8th

Light snow showers and flurries developed in the area during the early afternoon of January 8th. The snow continued briefly through the afternoon, ending as a few lingering flurries in the evening hours. Temperatures were between 10 - 15 degrees during the event.

Snow showers follow storm overnight of the 25th - 26th

After heavy rain moved through during the evening of the 25th, snow began to fall between 7 - 10 PM as temperatures quickly fell to the mid-30s. Light snow showers and flurries then continued on and off through the morning of the 26th before ending by 8 - 11 AM. Temperatures at this time were between 26 - 30 degrees with occasional wind gusts of 20 - 30 mph.

Scattered snow showers on March 10th and 11th

Periods of light snow showers began in the region between 11 AM - 2 PM on the 10th with temperatures initially in the mid-20s. Snow showers and flurries continued on and off through the evening and overnight, eventually ending as occasional flurries by 1 - 4 AM on the 11th. Temperatures rapidly fell to the single digits by the early morning as winds gusted to 20 - 30 mph. A few brief light snow showers returned during the late morning on the 11th, before quickly ending by 3 PM.

Snow event on March 21st - 22nd

A few very intermittent snow and rain showers occurred during the afternoon and evening of the 21st. After Midnight, scattered snow showers moved into the region and fell moderately at times. The snow continued to fall through the early morning of the 22nd as temperatures initially in the low to mid-30s quickly fell to the teens. Snow showers eventually tapered off by 8 - 11 AM as winds gusted to 25 - 35 mph during this period.

Rain to snow April 7th-8th

Throughout the 7th, rain was occurring with temperatures in the low-40s. As temperatures cooled to 34-37 degrees between 8-11 PM, the rain transitioned to a steady and light snow. Periods of light snow continued throughout the morning of the 8th before tapering to flurries and ending between 7-10 AM.

On & Off Snow Showers

After the widespread snowfall came to an end early on December 13th, additional snow showers quickly developed across much of northern Vermont.  While it didn't snow continuously, snow showers and flurries fell on and off between 8 AM and 4 PM on the 13th.  The higher elevations saw a few heavier squalls and not as many breaks to the snow.  Additional flurries fell into the evening hours.  It was very windy as well, gusts over 30 mph were reported.  Temperatures were very cold ranging from the single digits and low teens (highest elevations) to to the low 20s.

Scattered Snow Showers

As low pressure exited New England, colder air swept across the area. This changed any rain showers back to flurries and scattered snow showers during the early morning hours of December 20th.  The snow showers fell occasionally through the day and into the evening before ending completely by 9 PM later on the 20th.  Temperatures fell from the low and mid 30s into the 20s by 9 PM.

Another Round Of Snow Showers

Flurries and scattered snow showers moved across parts of northern Vermont between 2 - 9 PM on January 2nd.  Temperatures were mainly in the single digits.

Quick Moving System Brings Snow on December 7th

A period of light snow started between 1 - 4 AM on December 7th. The snow continued during the morning hours before coming to an end between 6 - 9 AM. Temperatures were between 28 - 32 degrees for the event.

Snow Showers December 8th and 9th

Light snow showers fell between 11 AM - 5 PM on December 8th. Wind gusts of 20 - 30 mph occurred during this period as temperatures were in the mid-30s. A break during the overnight hours occurred before a round of snow showers and flurries moved in by late morning of the 9th. Flurries continued through the rest of day before ending by the late evening with temperatures falling to the mid-20s.

Wintry mix late on the 10th.

Snow began between 5 - 6PM on the 10th, and became mixed with sleet at times into the evening, before ending by 9 - 11PM. Temperatures during this time began in the upper 20s then rose to 32. After a brief lull, another round of precipitation arrived towards Midnight as a wintry mix of rain / freezing rain, and some snow in spots until 4 - 6AM on the 11th. Temperatures at that point were 34 - 37 degrees.

A Wintry Mix For Northern Vermont

A period of light snow fell across the area between 2 – 6 PM on January 22nd.  The snow then changed to sleet and freezing rain during the evening hours and continued through about Midnight of January 23rd.  A plain rain fell throughout much of the 23rd before ending as a few flurries during the overnight hours into January 24th.  Temperatures started off in the mid to upper 20s before climbing to 30 – 32 degrees during the period of sleet and freezing rain.

Afternoon And Evening Snow Showers

Flurries and snow showers moved across the area between 3 - 9 PM on February 16th.  Temperatures started out in the low 30s then fell into the mid and upper 20s as the snow showers exited.

Overnight Wintry Mix

A period of freezing rain, mixed with sleet, fell across the area between 10 PM, April 15th and 2 AM, April 16th.  Temperatures ranged 30 - 33 degrees.

Flurries and Light Snow on the 27th - 28th

Scattered light snow showers and flurries occurred in the overnight hours of December 27th into the 28th. By 6 - 9 AM on the 28th, a period of steady light snow began that lasted into the early afternoon. The snow eventually tapered to flurries and ended by 3 - 6 PM. Temperatures during the event were between 26 - 30 degrees.

Wintry Mix To End The Weekend

Light snow arrived across the area between 7 - 8 AM on February 25th. The snow quickly changed to sleet, then to a period of freezing rain before changing to plain rain by 11 AM - Noon.  Temperatures ranged 30 - 32 degrees when the snow began, but climbed into the mid 30s by Noon.

Light snow early on the 15th.

Flurries and periods of light snow began between 1 - 3AM on the 15th. This continued into the morning, ending 10AM - 12PM. Temperatures during this period were between 18 - 25 degrees.

Snow showers January 26 - 27

Scattered snow showers and flurries began during the evening of January 26th. With temperatures in the mid-30s, the snow showers occasionally mixed with rain throughout the evening and into the overnight of the 27th. The snow showers remained scattered into the morning of the 27th before turning into periods of light snow during the afternoon and evening. Temperatures fell to 28 - 32 degrees by this time with any accumulating snow ending by Midnight. A few flurries fell at times into the morning of the 28th.

Passing snow showers overnight of February 5th into the 6th

A few flurries began during the evening of February 5th and were followed by brief snow showers and squalls that fell between 7 PM of the 5th and 1 AM into the 6th. Temperatures during the brief event held between 28 - 32 degrees with winds gusting to 25 - 35 mph at times.

Some Light Snow, Then Snow Showers

A period of light snow and flurries fell across much of northern Vermont between 1 - 6 PM on December 30th.  Scattered snow showers returned later in the evening before ending by Midnight of the 31st.  Temperatures were mainly in the single digits during the day, then fell to -10 to 0 after dark on the 30th.

Overnight Light Snow

After some late evening flurries, light snow developed across the area between 9 - 11 PM on February 17th.  Periods of light snow continued overnight before tapering off 5 - 7 AM on February 18th.  Temperatures were in the upper 20s to low 30s throughout the event.

Nor'easter Continues Through Late Morning

Periods of snow associated with the Wednesday - Friday nor'easter continued from 7 AM, March 9th until around 10 AM.  Then, additional flurries along with a few snow showers fell between 5 - 9 PM later on the 9th.  Temperatures ranged 28 - 31 degrees.

Some Light Snow And Flurries

A period of light snow and flurries fell across the area between 9 AM - 5 PM on December 29th.  There were some additional flurries along with a few light snow showers that blew through during the overnight hours from the 29th into December 30th.  It was very cold as temperatures ranged between -5 and 5 degrees.

Evening Snow Showers 

Areas of flurries and scattered snow showers moved across the area between 5 - 8 PM on April 8th.  Temperatures ranged 28 - 32 degrees.

Additional Snow For Vermont

As the nor'easter exited the area, occasional flurries and scattered snow showers fell throughout the day and into the nighttime hours of January 5th.  The snow showers continued all the way through the morning of January 6th before ending by the early afternoon.  Note: the snowfall reflected in this Certified Snowfall Total report starts at 7 AM, January 5th.  Wind gusts over 30 - 40 mph were common (especially on the 5th) lending to additional blowing and drifting snow and some variability to the accumulations.  Temperatures mainly ranged from -10 to 0 degrees.

Snow showers on February 3rd

Periods of light snow showers fell in the area between 8 AM - 2 PM on February 3rd. A break in snowfall followed before a brief period of snow showers and flurries returned between 11 PM and 2 AM on the 4th. Temperatures throughout the event remained between 20 - 25 degrees.

Snow showers and squalls on March 3rd - 4th

After a few early morning flurries, brief snow showers and snow squalls entered the area between 1 - 4 PM on March 3rd with temperatures in the upper teens. The snow showers and snow squalls continued on and off through the evening and locally fell heavy at times. By Midnight, the majority of the snowfall came to an end with a few intermittent snow showers and flurries returning throughout the morning of the 4th. Temperatures fell to 5 - 10 degrees by the morning hours with winds gusting to 25 - 35 mph at times.

Overnight Snow Showers

A fast moving disturbance produced flurries and a few light snow showers across the area between 9 PM, January 7th and 3 AM, January 8th.  There were additional areas of flurries that continued through 6 - 7 AM on the 8th.  Temperatures ranged 10 - 15 degrees except for some single digits in the higher elevations.

Light Snow on the 21st to 22nd

Light to moderate snow returned between 6 - 9 AM on November 21st. The snow persisted through the afternoon hours before tapering to scattered snow showers and flurries overnight. The snow showers and flurries ended between 8 - 11 AM on November 22nd. Temperatures held between 28 - 30 degrees during the event.

Snow Showers and Squalls on December 15th

Snow showers entered the area between 12 - 3 AM on December 15th. Multiple rounds of brief snow showers occurred during the day through 8 - 11 PM that night. The snow showers were briefly heavy at times with strong wind gusts of 30 - 45 mph that caused blowing and drifting snow. Temperatures during the morning began around 20 degrees and fell to near 0 by the end of the event.

Snow overnight of February 10th - 11th

Light snow developed in the area between 8 - 11 PM on February 10th with temperatures of 8 - 12 degrees. The snow continued steadily overnight into the 11th becoming briefly moderate before tapering to snow showers and flurries by daybreak. Light snow showers and flurries continued to fall on and off throughout the day, eventually ending by 5 - 8 PM. Temperatures by the end of the event gradually rose to the lower 20s.

On and off snow showers

An extended period of lake effect snow showers impacted much of northern Vermont.  Flurries and scattered snow showers (also isolated heavier snow squalls) fell across the area between 10 PM on December 10th and 8 AM December 11th.  Temperatures were mainly in the in the low and mid 20s.

Quick Moving System Brings Light Snow and Wintery Mix

A period of light snow began between 9 AM - 11 AM on November 24th. On and off snow showers continued throughout the day with a brief mix of snow and sleet in lower elevations. The wintery precipitation came to an end by midnight. Temperatures held steady between 32 - 36 degrees through the event.

Snow squalls and snow showers on March 9th

Between 3 - 8 AM, locally heavy snow squalls and snow showers passed through the area. As the snowfall entered the area, temperatures quickly fell from the upper 30s to near 32 degrees with winds gusting 25 - 35 mph. A few snow showers and flurries lingered after this period until midday as temperatures settled to 26 - 30 degrees.

A Few Rounds Of Snow Showers

Flurries and scattered snow showers moved across the area during the late afternoon hours on March 10th.  However, a more organized area of snow showers and even a few snow squalls fell between 9 PM, March 10th and 2 AM, March 11th.  Additional flurries continued into the late morning hours of March 11th before ending by Noon.  Temperatures ranged 30 - 33 degrees.

Rain To Snow, Then Periods Of Snow

Rain briefly changed to some sleet before changing to all snow between 5 - 10 AM on November 26th.  This was followed by a clipper system that arrived during the overnight hours.  Light snow developed 9 - 11 PM on November 26th.  Periods of snow fell through the night and into the morning of the November 27th before tapering off between 10 AM - Noon.  Additional snow showers and flurries continued through about mid afternoon.  Temperatures were 30 - 34 degrees early on the 26th before falling into the mid and upper 20s (some low 20s in elevations above 1000 feet) during the overnight hours of the 26th into the morning hours of the 27th.

A Wintry Mix For Vermont

After overnight snow exited the area, precipitation returned between 5 - 8 AM on December 23rd in the form of sleet and freezing rain.  This wintry mix fell intermittently through the morning and into the afternoon (some locations changed to a period of rain) before ending 2 - 5 PM later on the 23rd.  Flurries and scattered light snow showers then developed during the evening hours before coming to an end by Midnight of December 24th.  Temperatures were in the low to mid 20s when the wintry mix began early on the 23rd, then climbed to 30 - 34 degrees during the afternoon, only to fall back into the low and mid 20s by Midnight of the 24th.

Periods Of Light Snow For Northern Vermont

A slow moving storm system trekked across southern New England between January 16 - 17th and produced periods of light snow across northern Vermont.  Flurries and snow showers first moved through the region 3 - 8 AM on January 16th.  After some late morning and afternoon flurries, another period of light snow fell from 7 PM of the 16th - Midnight of January 17th.  Areas of flurries returned for the daytime hours of the 17th with very little additional accumulation.  Another round of flurries and light snow showers fell into the morning hours of January 18th.  Note: any snow that fell after 7 AM on January 18th will be covered in a separate Certified Snowfall Report.  Temperatures started out in the single digits early on January 16th, then climbed into the low to mid 20s during the afternoon hours of the 17th.

System Brings Snow on the 22nd

Steady light snow entered the region between 2 - 5 AM on December 22nd. The snow was moderate at times and continued through the morning and afternoon hours before tapering to flurries. The last of the snow came to an end between 4 - 7 PM later that day. Temperatures were between 28 - 32 degrees during the event.

Periods of afternoon snow

Periods of light snow and snow showers fell across much of northern Vermont Noon - 7 PM on November 20th.  Temperatures were steady in the low to mid 20s throughout the afternoon and into the early evening hours.

Periods Of Snow For Northern Vermont

Snow fell on and off between 7 PM, February 9th and 1 AM, February 10th.  Scattered flurries then continued overnight into the morning of the 10th.  Another period of snow fell between 3 - 11 PM later on February 10th.  Temperatures were steady in mid to upper 20s.

More April Wintry Mix

A mix of light snow, sleet, and freezing rain developed across the area between 2 - 4 PM on April 14th.  The wintry mix fell intermittently through the night and into the next morning before tapering off between 11 AM - 1 PM on April 15th.  Temperatures ranged 27 - 30 degrees.

Light snow on February 1st

Between 2 AM - 5 AM on February 1st, light snowfall began to fall in the area. Temperatures began near 20 degrees as the snow continued to fall steadily through the morning hours. By midday, the snow tapered to scattered snow showers and flurries, ending between 3 - 6 PM. Temperatures warmed to between 28 - 32 degrees during the afternoon.

System brings light snow February 9th

Snow developed in the area between 4 - 7 AM on February 9th with temperatures in the upper teens. The snow was steady and briefly moderate at times through the morning hours before tapering to lighter snow and ending by 11 AM - 2 PM. Temperatures by the end of the event fell to between 6 - 10 degrees.

A Period Of Afternoon Snowfall

After a few morning snow showers, a period of snow fell across the Burlington area between Noon - 5 PM on March 2nd.  Temperatures ranged 30 - 33 degees through the afternoon.

More Snow In April

Periods of snow fell across the Burlington area between 2 - 7 PM on April 6th.  Temperatures ranged 33 - 35 degrees. Due to warm pavement temperatures, most of the snow accumulation occurred on colder, non-paved surfaces.

On & Off Snow Showers

Intermittent snow showers fell across much of northern Vermont from 7 AM, January 8th into the morning hours of January 9th.  The most organized periods of these snow showers were between 8 AM - 1 PM on January 8th, then again between 3 - 8 AM on January 9th.  Temperatures on the 8th were mainly in the low to mid 20s, before rising into the upper 20s to low 30s by the morning of the 9th.

Snow squalls overnight of the 2nd into the 3rd

A few light to moderate snow bands moved into the area beginning between 6 - 9 PM on February 2nd. Snow accumulated quickly within these brief snow bands and lasted through Midnight. Light snow showers then followed and continued at times into the pre-dawn hours of the 3rd. Temperatures during the event were between 15 - 20 degrees.


Any snow that fell after 7 AM on February 3rd will be covered in a separate report.

More Snow For Vermont

After some early morning flurries, light snow developed across the area between 9 AM - Noon on December 18th.  The snow fell on and off into the evening (mixed with sleet at times) before tapering off between 10 PM - 1 AM December 19th.  Temperatures were in the teens when the snow began, then climbed into upper 20s to low 30s as the snow came to an end.

Periods Of Overnight Snow

After some flurries and scattered light snow showers during the daytime hours of February 1st, periods of snow fell between 9 PM later that evening and 3 AM on February 2nd.  Temperatures were in the low 30s when the periods of snow entered the area, but quickly fell into the mid and upper teens as the snow exited on the 2nd.

Snow on March 24th

Snow developed in the region between 6 - 9 AM on the 24th with temperatures in the upper 20s. Steady snow continued through the afternoon, falling heavily at times. By the early evening, rain occasionally began to mix with the snow as temperatures rose to the low to mid-30s. Snowfall eventually tapered off and ended by 12 - 3 AM on the 25th.

Periods Of Snow For Northern Vermont

Periods of snow developed over the area between 8 - 11 AM on February 4th.  The snow fell on and off through the afternoon and into the evening before ending 7 - 10 PM later on the 4th.  Temperatures ranged 28 - 32 degrees.  There was another period of snow between 4 - 7 AM on February 5th. Temperatures were in the low to mid 20s for this early morning snowfall.

Coastal storm delivers wintry mix across the area

Between 10 PM on January 23rd and 1 AM on the 24th, a light-moderate wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain began to occur. The precipitation continued through the afternoon mainly as freezing drizzle. By sunset, snow and sleet began to mix again before coming to an end between 11 PM and 2 AM on the 25th. Temperatures started the event between 32 - 34 degrees, but gradually decreased to 27 - 30 by the end.

Lengthy Storm Brings Snow to Vermont

A mix of rain and snow transitioned into all snow between 2 - 5 PM on November 20th. Moderate snow continued through the evening hours on the 20th before briefly ending as light snow showers between 1 - 4 AM on November 21st. Temperatures at the start of the event began in the upper 30s and fell into the lower 30s by the end of the event.

This report is for any snow through November 21st at 4AM. Additional snow that followed will be covered in a separate report.

Vermont Snow on December 5th

Moderate snow moved into the area between 4 - 7 AM on December 5th. Temperatures at the onset of the event were near 26 degrees. The steady snow became lighter during the morning hours before tapering to snow showers and flurries in the afternoon. The last of the flurries exited the area between 4 - 7 PM as temperatures rose to near 32 degrees.

Snow event on January 17th - 18th

Steady light to moderate snow began between 6 - 9 PM on the 17th with temperatures near 32 degrees. The snowfall continued overnight into the early morning of the 18th before lightening up by daybreak. A few occasional light snow and rain showers fell at times during the remainder of the morning and into the early afternoon. Temperatures during the event remained between 30 - 34 degrees.

Periods Of Light Snow And Snow Showers

Light snow developed across the area between 9 AM and Noon on March 4th. Intermittent snow, along with a few snow showers, continued through the afternoon and into the night.  The snow exited the region between 1 - 4 AM on March 5th.  Temperatures ranged 30 - 34 degrees.

Light to Moderate Snow on December 17th

Steady light snow entered the area between 3 - 6 AM on December 17th with temperatures in the upper teens. The snow became moderate at times after sunrise before tapering to flurries and eventually coming to an end between 2 - 4 PM. Temperatures by the end of the event rose to the mid-20s.

Any wintry precipitation that occurred overnight into the 18th will be included in a separate report.

Snow on December 29th - 30th

Steady light snow entered the area between 9 AM - 12 PM on December 29th. The snow continued through the afternoon hours and became moderate at times before tapering to flurries by 6 - 8 PM. A brief break followed before spotty snow showers and flurries returned during the early morning of the 30th. Scattered light snow showers and flurries continued through the morning, eventually ending by 12 PM on the 30th. Temperatures during the event held steady between 28 - 32 degrees.

Storm System Brings Snow December 11th and 12th

Light snow showers and flurries gave way to steady snow between 10 PM on the 11th and 1 AM on the 12th. The snow continued into the morning hours of the 12th and was moderate at times. By daybreak, the snow tapered to flurries. After a break in the precipitation during the afternoon hours, light snow showers returned during the evening before the last of the accumulating snow fell by midnight. Temperatures during the start of the event were in the mid-20's and gradually rose to near 30 degrees by the end.

A White Christmas For Vermont

Periods of light to occasionally moderate snow fell across the area between 1 - 10 AM on December 25th as low pressure developed along the New England coast.  Flurries and scattered snow showers returned to region during the afternoon hours later on the 25th.  Temperatures ranged from the upper teens in the higher elevations to the low and mid 20s elsewhere.  Also, there was some blowing and drifting of the snow as the wind gusted over 30 mph, especially during the late morning and afternoon hours of December 25th.

System brings snow, sleet, and freezing rain February 6th - 8th

Periods of light snow initially began between 1 - 4 PM on February 6th with temperatures in the upper teens. The snow continued throughout the 6th, becoming more intermittent during the overnight into the 7th. On and off snow showers persisted during the morning and early afternoon of the 7th, before steadier precipitation returned as snow, sleet, and freezing rain by midafternoon. Sleet and freezing continued during the overnight into the 8th and eventually ended by 2 - 5 AM. Temperatures gradually rose to 28 - 34 degrees by this time.

Long Duration Snow Event

A period of snow fell across the Burlington area between 10 AM and 1 PM on March 7th.  After a few afternoon and evening flurries, a steady snow developed between 7 - 9 PM later on the 7th.  The snow fell through the night into the morning of March 8th.  Periods of snow then continued through the day and into the night before tapering off after Midnight of March 9th.  However, snow showers developed towards sunrise later on the 9th and continued into the morning.  Also, winds gusted to 30 mph at times.  Temperatures ranged 28 - 32 degrees throughout the event.  Snow accumulations reflected in this report go through 7 AM of March 9th.  Any snow that fell after this time will be recorded in a separate Certified Snowfall report.

Periods Of Snow, Then Overnight Snow Showers

A nor'easter roared up the New England coast on January 4th, but the Burlington area was on the northwest fringe of the storm.  Light snow developed between 9 - 11 AM and fell through the afternoon before tapering off by evening.  This was followed by flurries and snow showers that fell overnight and into the morning of January 5th.  (The snow showers continued on and off through much of the 5th, but that will be covered by a separate Certified Snowfall Total report beginning 7 AM, January 5th).  Also, winds gusted over 40 mph throughout the event.  Temperatures were in the low to mid 20s during the day of January 4th, then fell into the low to mid teens by the morning of the 5th.

The gusty winds that accompanied this storm led to significant blowing and drifting snow.  This resulted in substantial variability of total snow accumulation.

Rain To Wintry Mix

Rain changed to a brief period of freezing rain between 9 - 11 PM on January 12th.  The freezing rain then changed to a period of sleet before changing to snow.  The snow fell into the morning of January 13th before tapering off to flurries between 10 AM - Noon.  Flurries continued at times through the afternoon.  Also, the wind gusted over 30 mph during the morning hours of the 13th.  Temperatures were in the low 30s during the changeover, then quickly fell through the 20s and into the low teens as the snow tapered off.

A Snowy Wednesday For Vermont

Snow developed across the area between 9 - 11 AM on February 7th.  The snow continued heavy at times through the afternoon and into the evening before ending 7 - 9 PM later on the 7th.  A few flurries and light snow showers then fell into the early morning hours of February 8th.  Temperatures were mainly in the teens throughout the event.

Heavy Snow For Northern Vermont

A strengthening area of low pressure provided northern Vermont with a heavy snowfall.  Snow developed 1 – 4 AM on December 12th and continued through the morning and afternoon.  The snow fell heavy at times and was accompanied by wind gusts over 30 mph.  The snow tapered off during the evening hours, but continued to fall intermittently through the overnight and into the morning of the 13th.  (Additional snow showers and flurries returned later that morning and into the afternoon of December 13th, but that will be covered in a separate Certified Snowfall Report).  Temperatures throughout the snowstorm were in the low to mid teens.

Late season snow March 31st - April 1st

A steady period of wet snow developed in the area between 10 AM - 1 PM on March 31st. The snow continued into the afternoon and mixed with rain at times as temperatures were 33 - 36 degrees. Steady periods of light to moderate snow followed overnight into April 1st as temperatures cooled to near 32 degrees. By the late morning of the 1st, the snow began to lighten up and eventually ended as a few snow showers between 12 - 3 PM.

More Snow For Vermont

Snow developed across central and northern Vermont between 7 - 10 AM on December 22nd as low pressure and a warm front approached New England.  The snow fell heavy at times through the afternoon and into the evening before tapering off between 11 PM later on the 22nd and 2 AM on December 23rd.  Some additional light snow and snow showers moved through until about daybreak of the 23rd.  Temperatures were in the single digits and low teens when the snow began, then climbed into the low to mid 20s by the time the snow ended.

Long duration snow event February 15th - 17th

A few initial predawn flurries gave way to steadier snowfall between 7 - 10 AM on February 15th with temperatures in the low to mid-30s. The snow quickly became moderate to heavy at times throughout the afternoon and evening hours, before tapering to lighter snowfall during the overnight into the 16th. Intermittent light snow showers and flurries then continued throughout the day on the 16th as temperatures gradually fell to the low to mid-20s. The main area of snowfall eventually came to an end by Midnight with just a few flurries lingering into the early morning of the 17th.

Coastal system brings significant snow

Steady snowfall developed in the area between 10 AM - 1 PM on February 12th. The snow quickly became moderate to heavy at times through the afternoon and evening hours. During the overnight of the 12th into the 13th, snowfall lightened and continued into the morning. Light snow showers eventually tapered off by 1 - 4 PM on the 13th with just a few flurries falling at times through the evening. Temperatures held between 23 - 28 degrees during the event.

Coastal Storm Produces Long Duration Snowfall

After some evening and early nighttime flurries, a steady snow developed across the area between 1 - 3 AM on March 13th.  The snow continued through the day and into the night, heavy at times as snowfall rates reached 1 - 2" per hour.  By the morning of March 14th, the snow became more intermittent and showery.  However, this continued through the afternoon and into the night before finally coming to an end 3 - 5 AM on March 15th.  Temperatures through the entire event ranged 29 - 32 degrees.

Nor'Easter brings heavy March snowfall

Steady snowfall entered the region between 7 - 10 AM on March 14th. The snow quickly became heavy through the morning and afternoon with temperatures in the upper teens to low 20s. By the late evening, the snow intensity lightened up and continued overnight into the 15th. A few moderate to heavy snow showers occurred during the late morning and early afternoon of the 15th before the snow showers became more scattered throughout the day, eventually ending by Midnight with temperatures around 20 degrees. Windy conditions throughout the event resulted in blowing and drifting snow with winds gusting to 25 - 40 mph at times.

Area of snow, rain, and graupel moves through the region November 27th

An area of brief snow that mixed with rain and graupel on November 27th moved through between 6-10AM with temperatures between 33-37 degrees. Accumulations were light and were mainly limited to colder and grassy surfaces.

Scattered flurries and brief light snow showers affect the region

A few areas of light snow and brief, passing flurries pushed through the region on December 2nd, mainly between 9am-12pm and 5-8pm. The snow remained light and intermittent as it fell, and fell with temperatures across the area between 28-32 degrees.

Rain changes to snow/flurries on December 25

On Christmas Day, rain and thunderstorms moving through the area changed briefly to snow and flurries as it tapered off and ended, leaving light accumulation on colder surfaces. Snow fell between 8-11AM with temperatures between 32-36 degrees. Strong winds accompanied the snow with gusts of up to 30-40 mph.

Flurries on January 3rd

Flurries began on January 3rd around 2-4AM, staying generally light, before ending in the morning around 7-10AM.  Temperatures during the morning were in the mid to upper-teens.

Brief Flurry/Snow Showers on January 12th

A few flurries/snow showers passed through the area during the afternoon on January 12th between 3-8PM. Temperatures at the time were in the 20's.

Light Snow Mix on January 24-25th

A light snow/freezing drizzle mix moved into the area after 9AM on January 24th and lingered into the early afternoon with temperatures in the upper 20's. Light snow/flurries returned to the area after 7PM with some lingering flurries through 2AM on January 25th for some locations with temperatures in the upper-teens.

Freezing Drizzle/Light Snow Mix on February 1-3

A few flurries fell during the morning and again on the afternoon of February 1st with freezing drizzle beginning during the late afternoon/evening hours. Freezing precipitation continued overnight before changing back to all snow and tapering off during the morning of February 2nd. A few brief periods of flurries fell during the day and again mixed with freezing fog overnight and tapered off during the morning of February 3rd. Temperatures during the event were in the upper-teens to mid-20s.

Brief Snow Squall on March 6th

A snow squall associated with a passing cold front moved through the area between 6-9AM on March 6th. Temperatures fell into the upper-20s to low-30s with winds gusting 20-45mph. Accumulations were reserved for higher elevations, and colder and elevated surfaces.

Snow Showers Pass Through on October 26th

Light snow showers/flurries moved into the area between 2-5PM on October 26th. Some locations saw multiple rounds of showers with steadier light snow into the evening before it tapered off and ended between 7-9PM. Temperatures through the event cooled from the mid-upper 30s to around 30 degrees.

Cold Front Brings Freezing Rain/Drizzle on October 30th

Precipitation associated with a cold front moved into the area between 2-4AM on October 30th. Most locations began as a light rain/drizzle with temperatures in the mid 30s. As temperatures cooled to the upper-20s through the early morning hours, precipitation changed over to a wintry mix of rain, snow, and freezing rain/drizzle. Some locations saw a break around sunrise with another round of freezing rain/drizzle which ended by 8-11AM.

Flurries/Light Snow Overspreads the Region on December 26th

Areas of fog and very light snow/flurries settled into the region between 12-3AM on December 26th. Very light snow/flurries continued through the morning hours before becoming intermittent and tapering back during the afternoon, although some areas saw light snow/flurries return in the evening before finally ending by 9-11PM. Temperatures during the day were mostly in the low teens.

Scattered Mixed Showers Early on January 7th

Scattered mixed showers of rain and snow/graupel passed through the region early on January 7th between 2-6AM. Temperatures were mostly in the mid 30s only allowing for brief accumulations mainly on colder and grassy surfaces.

Spotty Freezing Drizzle and Flurries on February 4th

Areas of spotty freezing drizzle and flurries settled into the region between 4-7AM on February 4th. While most of the fog lifted later in the morning, flurries/very fine snow continued through the morning before it ended towards Noon. Most locations did not have icing issues. Temperatures during the morning fell from the low 30s into the teens.

Morning Snow Showers on April 9th

Snow showers passed through the area between 7-10AM on April 9th. Some locations saw a brief mix with rain before temperatures fell into the low-mid 30s. Accumulations then quickly melted back due to the preceding warmth and rising temperatures that followed.

Light Rain to Snow on March 31 to April 1

Light rain/drizzle began to mix with snow between 7-10PM on March 31st and changed over to all snow at times overnight as temperatures fell into the low-mid 30s. Any snowfall was wet and slushy in some areas and tapered off to mostly rain/drizzle between 7-11AM on April 1st.

Freezing Drizzle and Light Snow Showers on November 7th

Some freezing drizzle/rain moved into the area between 2-5AM on November 7th, and mixed/changed over to light snow at times during the morning hours before it moved out towards 7-10AM. Freezing drizzle/fog returned that afternoon between 2-4PM and eventually gave way to a few light snow towards the evening before it ended around 8-11PM. Temperatures during the precipitation were in the upper 20s to low 30s.

Snow Showers on February 28th

A few scattered snow showers/squalls moved through the area just after Noon on February 28th and again that afternoon/evening, tapering off just before sunset. Temperatures were in the upper-20s to low-30s with winds 15-20mph.

Passing Flurries/Light Snow Shower on December 7th

A few passing flurries rolled through the region between 2-4PM on December 7th with a quick burst of light snow between 6-9PM. Temperatures during the snowfall were in the upper 20s to around 30 degrees, however, temperatures rose above freezing during the nighttime hours, causing melting.

Late-Afternoon Snow Showers on March 29th

Flurries and scattered light-moderate snow showers passed through the area between 4-9PM on March 29th. Some locations began as a brief rain or rain/snow mix before temperatures fell into the low-mid 30s during the snow.

Intermittent Light Snow on April 6th - 7th

Some patchy freezing fog and light snow developed over the area between 9AM - 12PM on April 6th although some locations areas saw a brief mix with rain before temperatures fell into the 20s during that time. Snow was briefly steady early in the day before tapering to intermittent light flurries late in the afternoon. Flurries became less frequent heading into the overnight but continued at times before finally coming to an end on April 7th between 7-10AM.

Freezing Drizzle and Snow on January 15th

Areas of freezing drizzle overspread the region on January 15th between 4-7AM, causing some icing for the morning commute. This began to mix and change to all snow by mid-morning, which continued to fall through midday before tapering off 1-3PM. Snow was mainly light with a few pockets of moderate snow with temperatures falling from the mid-upper 20s into the teens during the day.

Snow showers move through the region on December 11th

A few areas of light to moderate snow and snow showers pushed through the region on December 11th. Snow mainly fell between 2-5AM and 10AM-1PM. Snow showers were intermittent as they fell and fell with varying intensity. Temperatures were initially between 32-35 degrees, but cooled to 29-32 degrees in any snow showers.

Rain to Light Snow on March 24th

Wind driven rain during the night of March 23rd, mixed with and changed over to all snow in some locations between 1-3AM on March 24th as temperatures cooled into the mid 30s. Snow was briefly steady during the early morning with winds gusting 30-60mph, causing blowing and drifting snow. Snow lightened to a flurry/drizzle mix towards daybreak and tapered off between 7AM-10AM with temperatures returning into the upper-30s. Accumulating snowfall was heavy, wet and slushy. Better accumulations were seen in higher elevations and locations south of the immediate metropolitan area.

Flurries or Light Snow on February 22nd

Intermittent flurries or periods of light snow developed over the area between 1-4PM on February 22nd but remained light through the afternoon/evening before any lingering flurries tapered off by 7-10PM. Temperatures during the day were in the 20s.

Snow Showers on December 21st

Flurries moved into the region between 3-6AM on December 21st and increased to light snow showers, which fell through about midday. Most areas stopped seeing snow towards 12-2PM but some flurries lingered across the region through 6-9PM. Temperatures during the day cooled from the low-mid 20s into the teens. Wind gusts over 20mph cause some blowing and drifting snow.

System Brings Light Snow on December 13th-14th

Some flurries moved into the area between 9-11PM on December 13th but increased to a steady light snow around Midnight. Snow continued through the night with temperatures just below freezing but became intermittent and tapered off between 5-8AM on December 14th.

Rain to Brief Snow on March 28th

Rain during the afternoon on March 28th mixed and changed to a wet, light-moderate snow between 2-5PM as temperatures fell to near freezing. Snow quickly lightened up shortly after and mixed back with rain in some areas as it tapered off, causing melting and compaction. Early that evening, a few scattered rain/snow mixed showers passed through the area but any lingering precipitation tapered off around Midnight with temperatures falling below freezing overnight.

Snow moves through and affects the region on December 6-7

Areas of light to occasionally moderate snow moved through the region between December 6th and 7th. Snow began falling between 3-6pm and continued consistently into the evening hours. A few intermittent breaks were observed during the overnight and heading into the 7th. The snow then began to become more intermittent heading into the morning and especially the afternoon hours, as it tapered off to light snow showers before ending between 4-7pm. A few locations saw flurries linger into the evening/overnight hours, but any lingering flurries ended by midnight. Temperatures fell throughout the event; they began between 20-25 degrees, fell through the teens overnight and ended up between 6-13 degrees at the end of the event.

System Brings Wind Driven Snow on December 23rd

Snow moved into the area between 5-7PM on December 23rd with temperatures in the 20s. Snow quickly became steadier and moderate to heavy at times during the early part of the night with the bulk of the snow falling before Midnight, although some flurries or light snow lingered until 12-2AM on December 24th. Wind gusts over 30 mph at times, caused reduced visibility along with blowing and drifting snow with temperatures falling into the single digits at night.

Snow Showers on April 24th

Rain/snow mixed showers developed over the area between 1-3AM on April 24th, however, most areas didn't see accumulations until closer to dawn when temperatures fell around 32 degrees. Showers tapered off shortly after daybreak to some lingering drizzle/flurries before returning in the afternoon. Some areas saw a period of moderate snow during the afternoon before tapering to scattered rain/snow mixed showers in the evening and ending 8-11PM. Temperatures ranging from 32-36 degrees during the afternoon caused snow to frequently melt back under lighter precipitation.

Rain changes to snow on November 22

Areas of rain changed over to snow as colder air filtered into the region on November 22nd. The transition occurred between 5-8AM and snow continued falling through 12-3PM. Snow was light to moderate as it fell, though locations closer to and along the Palmer Divide saw periods of heavy snow at times. Temperatures were initially 33-36 degrees, but fell to 31-32 degrees during the snow. After the snow ended, temperatures rose back to the mid to upper 30s.

Period of Snow on February 15th-16th

Flurries and pockets of light snow developed over the area between 3-6PM on February 15th. Snow became steadier towards evening and continued into the early part of the night before tapering off and ending 12-2AM on February 16th. Temperatures during the snow fell from around 30 degrees into the upper-teens/low 20s. Winds gusts of 20-30mph also caused some blowing snow during the event.

Rain and Snow Showers on April 20th - 21st

Rain mixed and changed to periods of light snow between 10PM on April 20th and 1AM on April 21st as temperatures fell to 32-35 degrees. Light to moderate wet snow continued at times into the morning hours with some areas seeing a rain/snow mix through Noon before any lingering precipitation tapered off shortly after with temperatures in the mid-upper 30s. Warm grounds caused snow to melt/compact during the event.

Snow on April 3rd - 4th

Light snow showers moved into the area between 11PM on April 3rd and 1AM on April 4th with some areas beginning as rain before transitioning to all snow. Temperatures cooled into the low-mid 30s overnight with steady light/wet snow. Snowfall rates increased to a moderate snow around mid-morning with light snow ending around midday. Another steady snow shower/squall moved into the area early that evening between 4-6PM with winds gusting 20-30mph. Snow was generally light to moderate with temperatures in the low-30s. Snow ended around Midnight.

Snow on February 23 & 24

Snow moved into the area on the morning of February 23rd, with some areas beginning as rain. Snow was moderate to heavy at times in some locations with winds gusting 20-40mph. Temperatures cooled into the 20s during the afternoon with snow showers continuing into the evening and became less frequent and lighter overnight. Snow showers picked up again during the morning of February 24th but tapered off during the early afternoon.

Rain to Snow Showers on April 12th - 13th

Rain showers during the evening of April 12th mixed and changed over to areas of steady snow as temperatures cooled from the 40s into the low 30s between 11PM-2AM. Preceding warmth caused some melting initially although some areas continued to snow with at a light to moderate intensity before snow tapered off between 3-7AM on April 13th.

Snow January 4-5th

Light snow showers/flurries began on January 4th between 12-6AM and became steadier at times during the afternoon.  Snow was generally light to moderate through the day/evening and into the next morning before tapering off between 9AM-3PM on January 5th. Temperatures through the snow were in the single digits.

Strong storm brings snow, wind to eastern Colorado

A developing storm system brought snow to the area on November 17th, with snow beginning to fall across the area between 9am-12pm. The snow fell with varying intensity. While it was mainly light to moderate across the region, there were some heavier bands of snow. Snow continued into the afternoon and evening before tapering off and ending between 8-11pm. Temperatures were initially between 32-36 degrees, but fell to the upper 20s by the end of the event. Gusty winds of up to 40 mph were observed as well.

Freezing Drizzle and Snow on February 9th-10th

Freezing fog, patchy freezing drizzle and some flurries developed over the area between 5-8AM on February 9th and held through much of the morning with temperatures in the low-mid 20s. Freezing drizzle/fog briefly dissipated around midday but flurries and freezing fog redeveloped in the evening and lingered into the next morning. Snow increased to a steady, light snowfall before daybreak on February 10th and was followed by a few bursts of moderate to heavy snow in some areas towards midday. Snow lightened up in the afternoon although some areas saw flurries or light snow linger until 6-9PM. Temperatures in the teens created a very fluffy snow.

Patchy Freezing Drizzle and Snow on February 19th - 20th

Patchy freezing drizzle, freezing fog and flurries developed over the area between 10PM on February 18th and 1AM on February 19th. Precipitation changed to primarily flurries or light snow during the night, which continued into the daytime. Snow increased to periods of moderate snow at times during the late afternoon/evening but generally lightened up after Midnight and tapered off towards the pre-dawn on the 20th. While most of that day was dry, some locations saw a returning snow shower or flurries that afternoon/evening before the system finally exited towards Midnight. Temperatures ranged from the 20s during the start of the storm to the single digits and low-negatives towards the end.

A snow event brought accumulations to the area

Rain changed over to snow around 3/4am on the 18th of May. The snow was fairly moderate to heavy at times, persisting into much of the day, even mixing with a bit of sleet at times.The snow then came to and end in the morning around 9/10am on the 19th. Temperatures during this event were in the low to mid 30s.

Rain to Snow on March 26th - 27th

Rain during the afternoon on March 26th mixed and changed to all snow between 6-9PM as temperatures fell to 32 - 36 degrees. Periods of steady light to moderate snow continued into the night before gradually tapering off to flurries and ending 3-6AM on March 27th. Warm temperatures that preceded the snow caused much melting during the event even with low temperatures reaching around 30 degrees.

Snow on January 15-16th

Areas of light snow/flurries moved into the region on January 15th between 12-5PM. Steadier snow arrived during the late evening and lasted into the morning of January 16th before it tapered off between 9AM-1PM. Temperatures were near freezing during the snow.

Significant winter storm brings accumulating snow to the area

Precipitation broke out later in the evening of October 8th between 9PM and Midnight, but with temperatures starting between 33 and 35 degrees allowing this to initially to fall as a rain and snow mix. As intensity increased to a more consistent light to moderate, temperatures cooled just enough – to 32 degrees – to change the mix to all snow overnight. Steadiest snow persisted through the entire morning on the 9th, falling with heavy intensity at times. Snow was finally able to taper off and end between Noon and 3PM.

System Brings Freezing Drizzle and Heavy Snow on January 20th - 21st

Freezing drizzle pushed into the area between 10PM on January 20th and 12AM on January 21st with temperatures in the upper 20s. This continued into the early part of the night before mixing and changing over to all snow between 2-5AM. Snow increased to a moderate to heavy snow towards daybreak and was eventually accompanied by wind gusts over 30 mph towards midday. This caused significant blowing and drifting through the day before it tapered off 4-7PM.

Rain to Areas of Heavy Snow on March 18th

Rain and thunderstorms quickly changed over to areas of moderate to heavy bands of snow by 5-8PM on March 18th as temperatures sharply dropped into the low-mid 30s. Snow continued with areas of heavy bursts through the evening hours, before rates lightened up after Midnight as snow tapered off 1-3AM on March 19th. The preceding warmth caused snow to melt/compact especially as it first began.

Snow affects the area on December 16-17

A developing system moved through the region on December 16-17 and brought periods of snow that began falling between 7-10PM on the 16th. The snow varied in intensity from light to moderate to even heavy at times. The snow became mostly light during the late morning of the 17th before tapering off to flurries and ending between 12-3PM. Temperatures were initially in the 20s but fell sharply through the teens and single digits to between -5 and 5 degrees by the end of the event. Some gusty winds of up to 25 mph at times accompanied the snow, leading to blowing and drifting.

Snow on April 28th and 29th

A quick shot of rain changed to steady moderate to heavy snow between 3-5PM on April 28th and continued overnight mainly as a light steady snow. Snow remained steady throughout the day on April 29th before lightening up late in the evening and ending between 9-11PM. Temperatures during the event were in the upper 20s to low 30s with some areas of blowing and drifting snow due to wind gusts of 30 mph.

Light Snow From Clipper on January 31st, 2017

With temperatures in the low to mid 30s, intermittent areas of light snow arrived between 8-10am as a clipper system moved into the region. Brief bursts of steadier snow grains mixed in during the event, before any precipitation tapered to flurries and ended 1-4pm with temperatures remaining in the low to mid 30s.

Snow Showers with Arctic Front on March 3, 2017

With temperatures starting 35-40 degrees, an area of snow showers and flurries developed across the region during the late afternoon on March 3rd between 5-9pm. While snow showers and flurries moved through winds also increased, gusting to 25-40 mph and remained breezy overnight. After snow showers exited, temperatures fell into the lower 20s overnight with mainly clear skies.

Disturbance Brings Freezing Rain and Sleet on January 8th

Between 2-5pm, areas of freezing rain and sleet arrived across the area with temperatures ranging 27-32 degrees on January 8th. A mix of freezing rain and sleet continued, intermittent at times into the evening, before ending between 8-10pm. Temperatures remained steady 27-32 degrees after precipitation exited.

Rain Ends as Wet Snow Early on February 2nd

Periods of rain continued into the early morning on February 2nd as temperatures were in the mid 30s. As colder air rushed into the region rain mixed and changed briefly to a period of wet snow between 5-7am as precipitation ended. Temperatures quickly fell to 28-32 by daybreak as winds gusted to 20-30 mph.

Morning Snow Showers on February 5th

With temperatures starting 34-38 degrees, scattered snow showers and snow grains developed between 7-9am on February 5th as a cold front moved through the region. Temperatures fell to 30-33 degrees after snow showers exited with winds gusting 20-30 mph.

Mixed Precipitation Before Changing to Rain on February 7th

With temperatures 30-32 degrees, areas of mixed sleet and snow developed between 5-8 am on February 7th. By 9 am, the snow and sleet changed to freezing rain. As temperatures warmed to 34-38 degrees between 9 - 11am, the precipitation changed to plain rain.

Storm System Brings Wintry Mix on January 14th, 2017

With temperatures ranging from 28-32 degrees, areas of mixed light snow and sleet developed between 12-3pm on January 14th. Snow was briefly moderate at times into the afternoon as temperatures held steady. Snow transitioned to light freezing rain and drizzle between 4-6pm which lingered through 9-11pm before ending with temperatures remaining 28-32 degrees for the remainder of the overnight.

December 11 Early AM Snow Showers 

With temperatures ranging from 30-34 degrees, scattered snow showers, briefly steady at times, moved through the region between 3-6am on the morning of December 11th. After snow showers exited, temperatures rose into the upper 30s to 40 during the afternoon.

Strong Cold Front changes Rain to Wintry Mix 

With temperatures in the 40s, areas of rain developed between 9-10pm on November 19th, 2016 as a potent cold front moved through the region. As colder air filtered in, rain mixed and changed to a period of snow and sleet, at times steady, betwen 10pm-1am into November 20th as temperatures fell to 33-36 degrees. Precipitation became light and ended between 1-2am as temperatures held between 34-37 overnight.

Wintry Mix on March 20th

With temperatures in the mid 30s, areas of mixed rain and sleet moved into the region between 2-5pm on March 20th. In heavier bursts of precipitation, areas of sleet/snow developed through the afternoon causing temperatures to fall to 31-32 degrees. Any snow and sleet mixed with pockets of drizzle and freezing drizzle as precipitation became lighter before diminishing 8-11pm, with temperatures rising to 33-36 degrees into the overnight.

Overnight Snow Affects Area December 14-15th, 2016

With temperatures ranging from 30-35 degrees, an area of snow showers arrived over the area between 11pm-3am on December 14th going into the 15th. Snow showers included embedded moderate to heavy areas snow at times during the period as they moved through. After the snow showers exited, temperatures fell into the upper 20s by the morning.

Snow Showers and Squalls Affect Area on March 15th, 2017

With temperatures ranging from 23-28 degrees, scattered snow showers and flurries moved across the region starting 11am-2pm on March 15th. Winds were also quite gusty, ranging from 20-35 mph. Between 2-8pm, isolated snow squalls developed along with the snow showers. Contained with these squalls were white-out conditions, wind gusts to 40-45 mph, and very heavy snow. Between 8-10pm, any snow showers and flurries exited with temperatures falling to 20-25 overnight.

Wintry Mix Impacts Area December 17th, 2016

With temperatures in the low to mid 20s, light snow developed over the area between 1-4am on December 17th. Snow increased in intensity and became steady at times after 5am as temperatures were in the mid to upper 20s. As warmer air above the surface moved into the area, snow transitioned to a sleet and freezing rain mix between 6-8am. Eventually, any mix turned to areas of freezing rain before becoming light and very scattered between 10am-Noon. Areas of drizzle remained into the afternoon and evening with temperatures ranging from 33 - 36 degrees, thus continuing to allow for patchy ice. Because of the preceding arctic air mass, patchy ice was possible on ground surfaces even with air temperatures slightly above 32 degrees. Heading into the evening, it remained 33-36 degrees with areas of dense fog, returning scattered rain showers and drizzle Then between 8-11PM, temperatures quickly rose to 35-40 degrees ending any ice threat.

Storm System Brings Snow on January 5-6, 2017

With temperatures starting in the upper 20s to near 30, light snow developed across the area starting 10PM-2AM on January 5th into the 6th. Snow became moderate to heavy at times before tapering to intermittent flurries and ending 7-10AM with temperatures remaining steady into the morning.

Snow with Clipper System Late December 13th into 14th

Starting 10pm-12am from December 13th into the 14th a clipper system brought snow into the region. Snow was light to moderate overnight into December 14th as temperatures ranged between 23-30 degrees. Snow became intermittent after 1-3am, lulling to flurries at times. Any lingering flurries and snow showers came to an end between 6-8am as temperatures held 23-30 degrees. After snow ended, temperature rose to 35-40 degrees during the afternoon with wind gusts 20-30 mph.

Coastal System Brings Areas of Snow January 29th-30th

Temperatures began in the upper 30s as precipitation arrived during the late evening on January 29th as rain showers. Rain showers mixed then transitioned to snow between 11pm-2am into January 30th as temperatures settled into the low 30s. Areas of light to steady snow continued overnight before tapering to intermittent flurries between 5-8am with temperatures in the low 30s. Intermittent flurries and snow showers continued into the afternoon as temperatures rose into the mid 30s before precipitation exited 3-6pm with temperatures falling into the 20s during the evening. Due to previous warmth, accumulation on paved surfaces was variable, and generally less than colder and grassy surfaces.

Rain Changes to Snow During the Morning on January 17th

As a disturbance moved into the region from the west, areas of rain developed between 1-4am across the area on January 17th with temperatures ranging from 34-39 degrees. Cooler air and more moisture from a developing low pressure system off the coast caused rain to mix then transition to snow between 6-10am. Snow became steady at times before becoming intermittent and ending 12-3pm as temperatures fell to 28-32 degrees. Temperatures remained steady before falling into the mid 20s by sunset.

Clipper System Brings Snow on December 30th

With temperatures in the upper teens, light snow and flurries developed over the region between 6-9am on December 30th as a clipper system moved through the region. Temperatures remained steady as light, to at times steady, snow continued into the morning. Between 8am-12pm, a heavier band of snow developed producing 0.5-1" per hour rates. Between 12-4pm, snow tapered to flurries and ended with temperatures ranging from 20-25 degrees.

Early April System Brings Snow

With temperatures starting in the mid-upper 30s areas of light snow developed across the area starting 4-7am on April 2nd, which briefly mixed with rain initially. Light to moderate snow continued through the morning, with embedded heavier pockets, as temperatures settled to 32-34 degrees. Snow tapered to flurries and ended 9-11am with temperatures rising into the 40s during the afternoon.

Snow Develops During the Evening on February 17th

With temperatures in the mid-upper 30s, areas of mixed rain and snow arrived across the area between 4-7pm on February 17th. Any rain changed to snow which was heavy with 1"/hr rates and caused temperatures to settle to 32-35 degrees. As warmer air arrived into the area, snow began to mix with and change to rain between 8-10pm before exiting 10pm-12am with temperatures ranging from 32-34 degrees through daybreak.

Coastal Storm Brings Accumulating Snow on December 15

As a coastal storm developed out to sea, snow quickly developed between 12-3 PM on December 15th, and became steady during the late afternoon and evening rush hour, with intervals of moderate to heavy snow. At the onset of snow, temperatures were in the upper 20s, but settled into the mid 20s as snow became steady. The snow came to an end between 6-9 PM. After snow ended, temperatures fell into the upper teens to lower 20s overnight.

Morning snow with late-day squalls

It was a mild overnight from the 9th heading into the 10th with temperatures falling from the 60s on the 9th down to near 37-41 degrees by 6AM on the 10th. It was between 630-830 AM that light rain quick developed into steady snow across the area while temperatures fell to near 32 degrees. Steady snow persisted through the morning hours before winding down and ending between 12PM-2:30PM on the 10th. Temperatures remained near 32 throughout the event, and once the event ended, only rose back into the mid-30s with breezy conditions. Close on the heels of th snow and generally between 2:30-8:00PM, additional snow showers and squalls impacted the area. Some of these squalls produced heavy snow for a brief period leading to additional accumulations, generally between a coating-0.5". Increasing northwest winds, sustained at 10-18mph with gusts 25-30, ushered in very cold air and also led to some minor blowing and drifting snow.

Note: The snow totals contained in this report are representative of official snow measuring surfaces. Due to prior warmth, marginal temperatures during snowfall and the March sun angle, pavement accumulations were generally less, and subject to considerable variations.

Strong Coastal System Brings Snow and Wintry Mix to the Area on March 14th 2017

With temperatures starting 28-32 degrees, an area of snow entered the region between 11pm-2am late on March 13th into the 14th. Snow was steady at times, before mixing with periods of sleet and freezing rain between 4-7am as winds became strong gusting to 30-40 mph. Temperatures remained 30-32 degrees as combinations of freezing rain, sleet, and snow continued into the morning. This extensive period of very heavy sleet and freezing rain amounted to approximately 1.5-2.5" inches of sleet. With sleet being generally three to four times more dense than snow, this led to an extremely heavy and dense snow/sleet pack relative to the overall accumulation. Further weight was added to this overall accumulation on the ground with the addition of rain and freezing rain which occurred during this time. Between 10am-1pm, the mixed precipitation became scattered with an intermittent snow and sleet mix remaining into the afternoon. This mixed changed to snow and ended around 3-6pm with temperatures still holding 28-32 degrees. Winds remained gusty overnight as temperatures fell into the 20s.

**Accumulation in the "Total" column are representative of combined non-compacted snow and sleet accumulation per standard snow measurement guidelines. Accumulation listed under "Ice" indicates any additional ice accretion from freezing rain only, if applicable.

First Widespread Snowfall of the Season on December 9th

A coastal system moved up the coast and brought snow over the area on December 9th. Flurries and intermittent pockets of light snow first began between 7-10 AM as temperatures fell from the mid 30s down to 30-34 degrees. Snow became steady between 10am-2pm and continued light to moderate through the day as temperatures settled and held in the lower 30s. Snow generally turned lighter into the evening before completely ending between 11PM-2AM into December 10th as temperatures fell into the mid-upper 20s overnight. Pavement accumulation was variable and generally less than colder surfaces during the daytime.

Powerful Coastal Storm Brings Snow, Rain and Wind

A very strong Nor'easter brought heavy precipitation to the region on March 2nd. Precipitation started as rain (which began late on March 1) with temperatures in the upper 30s to lower 40s. Starting 8-11 AM on March 2, rain mixed with snow before changing over to all snow by the early afternoon. Snow fell steady to heavy at times before tapering down to flurries down to flurries and ending between 8-11pm. When wintry precipitation was falling, the temperature was between 33 and 37 degrees and held in that range after precipitation ended. In addition to the precipitation, winds were quite strong. Gusts were frequently 40-50 mph, with some spots exceeding 60 mph at times.

Coastal Storm Brings Snow Early on March 13th

With temperatures ranging from 32-36 degrees, areas of mixed rain and snow showers which were around during the late evening on March 12th changed over to all snow between 12-3am on March 13th. Temperatures remained 32-36 degrees, as snow continued through the morning hours, steady to heavy at times, with winds gusting to 25-35 mph. Snow tapered to flurries and ended 10am-1pm with temperatures rising into the upper 30s to lower 40s through the afternoon.

Coastal Storm Hits Area on February 9th, 2017

With temperatures starting 37-42 degrees, steady rain developed across the region between 1-4am. As colder air filtered in, rain mixed and changed to a period of steady sleet between 4-7am. The mix transitioned to snow between 6-9am, which was heavy at times into the morning with 1-2"/hr rates. Winds also became quite gusty with wind gusts 30-40 mph as temperatures fell into the lower 30s. Moderate to heavy snow tapered to light snow and flurries between 12-3pm before ending between 3-5pm with temperatures remaining steady in the upper 20s into the afternoon. Wind gusts increased to 40-50 mph after snow ended into the evening which caused prolonged and significant blowing and drifting of snow with temperatures falling into the upper teens to lower 20s overnight.

Rain and Heavy Snow with Powerful Coastal Storm March 6th into the 7th

With temperatures starting in the mid-upper 30s, mixed rain and snow showers developed between 10 PM and 1 AM during the overnight of March 6th into the 7th. These mixed showers changed over to a few periods of all snow during the pre-dawn hours of March 7th. With temperatures in the mid 30s, combinations of rain and snow occurred through the morning to the midday until the powerful coastal storm strengthened to change the precipitation to predominately heavy snow between 1 and 3 pm. Snow fell at embedded 1-2"/hr rates with thunder and lightning, and wind gusts 30-40 mph. The snow tapered to intermittent flurries and light snow between 5-7pm which lingered through 8-10pm before completely ending. Temperatures settled to 30-34 degrees overnight. The combination of a dense, wet snow and windy conditions led to downed trees and wires.

Major Coastal Storm Impacts Area on January 7th, 2017

With temperatures steady in the lower 20s for the entire period, areas of light snow moved into the area between 5-8am on January 7th. Due to the cold, dry airmass in place snow was of a dry and powdery nature. Snow became moderate to heavy at times into the afternoon producing whiteout conditions and 1-2" per hour snowfall rates. Winds gusted to 20-30 mph during the event which caused blowing and drifting. Snow tapered to flurries before ending 5-8pm as the coastal system exited east.

Heavy Snow on March 21st with Coastal Storm

Temperatures started 33-36 degrees with mixed snow, sleet, and rain around during the morning hours on March 21st. Any mix changed to snow 10am-1pm, which became steady to heavy into the afternoon and evening with embedded 2-4"/hr rates. Temperatures fell to 30-32 during the snowfall with wind gusts 25-35 mph. Heavy snow tapered to intermittent light snow and flurries between 12-3am. Any lingering flurries and light snow ended 3-6am on March 22nd with temperatures ranging from 32-34 degrees.

Major Coastal Storm Brings Heavy Snow and Wind January 3rd into the 4th

With temperatures starting 28-32 degrees, areas of light snow arrived into the area between 11pm-2am on January 3rd into the 4th. Bands of steadier to heavy snow developed overnight as winds increased gusting to 30-40 mph. Temperatures fell into the low-mid 20s by daybreak as snow became heavy with 1- 3"/hr rates and blizzard-like conditions. Strong winds continued into the morning with gusts 40-50 mph as heavy snow continued with temperatures in the lower 20s. Snow became more intermittent and lighter between 1-4pm, with any areas of lingering snow coming to an end 5-8pm. Strong winds with gusts 35-50 mph continued into the overnight as temperatures held steady in the low to mid 20s.

The combination of strong winds, heavy snow and a long period of cold weather made this a high-impact storm. Winds in particular led to significant blowing and drifting, which resulted in substantial variability of snow accumulation and higher-than-normal drifts.

Scattered flurries and snow showers briefly occurred between 4 - 8 AM on December 11th. Temperatures were between 31 - 34 degrees during the event before rising into the upper 30s to 40 degrees by mid-day.

Wintry mix on January 8th

Initial rain overspread Long Island by 3 - 5 PM on the 8th with temperatures between 34 - 36 degrees. Periodic mixes of sleet, snow, and freezing rain then followed into the early evening as temperatures cooled to between 30 - 32 degrees. Most areas stopped precipitating by 8 PM but wintry mixes continued along the South Shore and the South Fork until 10-11 PM before ending.

Storm brought rain to snow on January 17th

Rain fell during the pre-dawn hours on the 17th with temperatures in the mid-to-upper 30s. Rain then mixed and changed to a light to briefly moderate wet snow by 9 AM - 12 PM as temperatures settled between 33 - 36 degrees. Any snow or rain/snow mix then ended by 2 - 5 PM.

Returning snow showers on January 30th
